  7210                                  
  7211                                  		;;push	es
  7212                                  		;;mov	ax,SYSINIT_SEG
  7213                                  		;;mov	es,ax
  7214                                  		;;mov	byte [es:toomanydrivesflag],1
  7215                                  					; set message flag
  7216                                  		;;pop	es
  7217                                  		;
  7218                                  		;mov	byte [SYSINIT+toomanydrivesflag],1
  7219                                  dmax_ok:				
  7220 0000227F C3                      		retn
  7221                                  
  7222                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7223                                  
  7224                                  ; 18/10/2022
  7225                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7226                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0						
  7227                                  ;								 
  7228                                  ;	link next bds (at ds:di) into the chain. assume that the
  7229                                  ;	  chain is entirely within ds == datagrp. also update drvmax,
  7230                                  ;	  dskdrv_table, and end_of_bdss.	
  7231                                  
  7232                                  xinstall_bds:		
  7233 00002280 56                      		push	si
  7234 00002281 53                      		push	bx
  7235 00002282 8B36[1901]              		mov	si, [start_bds]	; get first bds
  7236                                  xinstall_bds_1:				
  7237 00002286 833CFF                  		cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; is this the last one?
  7238 00002289 7404                    		jz	short xinstall_bds_2 ;	skip ahead if so
  7239                                  		;mov	si, [si+BDS.link]
  7240 0000228B 8B34                    		mov	si, [si]	; chain	through	list
  7241 0000228D EBF7                    		jmp	short xinstall_bds_1
  7242                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7243                                  
  7244                                  xinstall_bds_2:				
  7245                                  		;mov	[si+BDS.link], di
  7246 0000228F 893C                    		mov	[si], di
  7247                                  		;mov	[si+BDS.link+2], ds
  7248 00002291 8C5C02                  		mov	[si+2], ds
  7249                                  		;mov	word [di+BDS.link], -1
  7250 00002294 C705FFFF                		mov	word [di], 0FFFFh ; make sure it is a null ptr.
  7251                                  		;mov	[di+BDS.link+2], ds
  7252 00002298 8C5D02                  		mov	[di+2], ds ; might as well plug segment
  7253                                  		; 20/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7254                                  		;lea	bx, [di+BDS.BPB]
  7255 0000229B 8D5D06                  		lea	bx, [di+6]
  7256 0000229E 8B36[5217]              		mov	si, [last_dskdrv_table]
  7257 000022A2 891C                    		mov	[si], bx
  7258 000022A4 8306[5217]02            		add	word [last_dskdrv_table], 2
  7259 000022A9 FE06[7500]              		inc	byte [drvmax]
  7260 000022AD 8306[5417]64            		add	word [end_of_bdss], 100 ; BDS.size = 100
  7261 000022B2 5B                      		pop	bx
  7262 000022B3 5E                      		pop	si
  7263 000022B4 C3                      		retn
  7264                                  
  7265                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7266                                  
  7267                                  ; 17/10/2022
  7268                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7269                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7270                                  ; 03/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  7271                                  
  7272                                  cmos_clock_read:	
  7273 000022B5 50                      		push	ax
  7274 000022B6 51                      		push	cx
  7275 000022B7 52                      		push	dx
  7276 000022B8 55                      		push	bp
  7277 000022B9 31ED                    		xor	bp, bp
  7278                                  loop_clock:				
  7279 000022BB 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  7280 000022BD 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7281 000022BF B402                    		mov	ah, 2
  7282 000022C1 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- READ REAL TIME CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  7283                                  					; Return: CH = hours in	BCD
  7284                                  					; CL = minutes in BCD
  7285                                  					; DH = seconds in BCD
  7286 000022C3 83F900                  		cmp	cx, 0
  7287 000022C6 7512                    		jnz	short clock_present
  7288 000022C8 83FA00                  		cmp	dx, 0
  7289 000022CB 750D                    		jnz	short clock_present
  7290 000022CD 83FD01                  		cmp	bp, 1		; read again after a slight delay, in case clock
  7291 000022D0 741C                    		jz	short no_readdate ; was	at zero	setting.
  7292 000022D2 45                      		inc	bp		; only perform delay once.
  7293 000022D3 B90040                  		mov	cx, 4000h	; 16384
  7294                                  delay:					
  7295 000022D6 E2FE                    		loop	delay
  7296 000022D8 EBE1                    		jmp	short loop_clock
  7297                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7298                                  
  7299                                  clock_present:				
  7300 000022DA 2EC606[F304]01          		mov	byte [cs:havecmosclock], 1 ; set the flag for cmos clock
  7301 000022E0 E81000                  		call	cmosck		; reset	cmos clock rate	that may be
  7302                                  					; possibly destroyed by	cp dos and
  7303                                  					; post routine did not restore that.
  7304 000022E3 56                      		push	si
  7305 000022E4 E842F2                  		call	read_real_date	; read real-time clock for date
  7306 000022E7 FA                      		cli
  7307                                  		;mov	ds:daycnt, si	; set system date
  7308 000022E8 8936[F004]              		mov	[daycnt], si
  7309 000022EC FB                      		sti
  7310 000022ED 5E                      		pop	si
  7311                                  
  7312                                  no_readdate:				
  7313 000022EE 5D                      		pop	bp
  7314 000022EF 5A                      		pop	dx
  7315 000022F0 59                      		pop	cx
  7316 000022F1 58                      		pop	ax
  7317 000022F2 C3                      		retn
  7318                                  
  7319                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7320                                  
  7321                                  ; the following code is written by jack gulley in engineering group.
  7322                                  ; cp dos (CP/DOS, OS/2) is changing cmos clock rate for its own purposes
  7323                                  ; and if the use cold boot the system to use pc dos while running cp dos,
  7324                                  ; the cmos clock rate are still slow which slow down disk operations
  7325                                  ; of pc dos which uses cmos clock. pc dos is put this code in msinit
  7326                                  ; to fix this problem at the request of cp dos.
  7327                                  ;
  7328                                  ; the program is modified to be run on msinit. equates are defined
  7329                                  ; in cmosequ.inc. this program will be called by cmos_clock_read procedure.
  7330                                  ;
  7331                                  ;  the following code cmosck is used to insure that the cmos has not
  7332                                  ;	had its rate controls left in an invalid state on older at's.
  7333                                  ;
  7334                                  ;	it checks for an at model byte "fc" with a submodel type of
  7335                                  ;	00, 01, 02, 03 or 06 and resets the periodic interrupt rate
  7336                                  ;	bits in case post has not done it. this initilization routine
  7337                                  ;	is only needed once when dos loads. it should be run as soon
  7338                                  ;	as possible to prevent slow diskette access.
  7339                                  ;
  7340                                  ;	this code exposes one to dos clearing cmos setup done by a
  7341                                  ;	resident program that hides and re-boots the system.
  7342                                  
  7343                                  cmosck:					; check and reset rtc rate bits	
  7344                                  
  7345                                  ;model byte and submodel byte were already determined in msinit.
  7346                                  
  7347                                  	; 16/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  7348                                  	; 19/03/2018 (Model: 0FCh, Sub Model: 01h, REF: AMIBIOS Prog. Guide)
  7349                                  			
  7350 000022F3 50                      		push	ax
  7351 000022F4 2E803E[3E06]FC          		cmp	byte [cs:model_byte], 0FCh
  7352 000022FA 7525                    		jnz	short cmosck9	; Exit if not an AT model
  7353 000022FC 2E803E[3F06]06          		cmp	byte [cs:secondary_model_byte], 6
  7354                                  					; Is it 06 for the industral AT ?
  7355 00002302 7408                    		jz	short cmosck4	; Go reset CMOS	periodic rate if 06
  7356 00002304 2E803E[3F06]04          		cmp	byte [cs:secondary_model_byte], 4
  7357                                  					; Is it 00, 01, 02, or 03 ?
  7358 0000230A 7315                    		jnb	short cmosck9	; EXIT if problem fixed by POST  
  7359                                  					; Also,Secondary_model_byte = 0 
  7360                                  					;   when AH=0C0h, int 15h failed.
  7361                                  					;	RESET THE CMOS PERIODIC RATE 
  7362                                  					;  Model=FC submodel=00,01,02,03 or 06 
  7363                                  cmosck4:				
  7364 0000230C B08A                    		mov	al, 8Ah		; cmos_reg_a|nmi
  7365                                  					; NMI disabled on return
  7366 0000230E B426                    		mov	ah, 26h		; 00100110b
  7367                                  					; Set divider &	rate selection
  7368 00002310 E83000                  		call	cmos_write
  7369 00002313 B08B                    		mov	al, 8Bh		; cmos_reg_b|nmi
  7370                                  					; NMI disabled on return
  7371 00002315 E80B00                  		call	cmos_read
  7372 00002318 2407                    		and	al, 7		; 00000111b
  7373                                  					; clear	SET,PIE,AIE,UIE,SQWE
  7374 0000231A 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
  7375 0000231C B00B                    		mov	al, 0Bh		; cmos_reg_b
  7376                                  					; NMI enabled on return
  7377 0000231E E82200                  		call	cmos_write
  7378                                  cmosck9:				
  7379 00002321 58                      		pop	ax
  7380 00002322 C3                      		retn
  7381                                  
  7382                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7383                                  
  7384                                  ;--- CMOS_READ -----------------------------------------------------------------
  7385                                  ;		read byte from cmos system clock configuration table	       :
  7386                                  ;									       :
  7387                                  ; input: (al)=	cmos table address to be read				       :
  7388                                  ;		bit    7 = 0 for nmi enabled and 1 for nmi disabled on exit    :
  7389                                  ;		bits 6-0 = address of table location to read		       :
  7390                                  ;									       :
  7391                                  ; output: (al)	value at location (al) moved into (al). if bit 7 of (al) was   :
  7392                                  ;		on then nmi left disabled.  during the cmos read both nmi and  :
  7393                                  ;		normal interrupts are disabled to protect cmos data integrity. :
  7394                                  ;		the cmos address register is pointed to a default value and    :
  7395                                  ;		the interrupt flag restored to the entry state on return.      :
  7396                                  ;		only the (al) register and the nmi state is changed.	       :
  7397                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7398                                  
  7399                                  cmos_read:				; read location (al) into (al)	
  7400 00002323 9C                      		pushf
  7401 00002324 FA                      		cli
  7402 00002325 53                      		push	bx
  7403 00002326 50                      		push	ax		; AL = cmos table address to be	read
  7404 00002327 0C80                    		or	al, 80h
  7405 00002329 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7406                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7407 0000232B 90                      		nop			; (undocumented	delay needed)
  7408 0000232C E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7409 0000232E 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax
  7410 00002330 58                      		pop	ax
  7411 00002331 2480                    		and	al, 80h
  7412 00002333 0C0F                    		or	al, 0Fh
  7413 00002335 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7414                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7415 00002337 90                      		nop
  7416 00002338 E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7417 0000233A 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  7418 0000233C 5B                      		pop	bx
  7419 0000233D 0E                      		push	cs		; *place code segment in stack and
  7420 0000233E E80100                  		call	cmos_popf	; *handle popf for b- level 80286
  7421 00002341 C3                      		retn			; return with flags restored
  7422                                  
  7423                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7424                                  
  7425                                  cmos_popf:				
  7426 00002342 CF                      		iret			; popf for level b- parts
  7427                                  					; return far and restore flags
  7428                                  
  7429                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7430                                  
  7431                                  ;--- cmos_write ----------------------------------------------------------------
  7432                                  ;		write byte to cmos system clock configuration table	       :
  7433                                  ;									       :
  7434                                  ; input: (al)=	cmos table address to be written to			       :
  7435                                  ;		bit    7 = 0 for nmi enabled and 1 for nmi disabled on exit    :
  7436                                  ;		bits 6-0 = address of table location to write		       :
  7437                                  ;	 (ah)=	new value to be placed in the addressed table location	       :
  7438                                  ;									       :
  7439                                  ; output:	value in (ah) placed in location (al) with nmi left disabled   :
  7440                                  ;		if bit 7 of (al) is on. during the cmos update both nmi and    :
  7441                                  ;		normal interrupts are disabled to protect cmos data integrity. :
  7442                                  ;		the cmos address register is pointed to a default value and    :
  7443                                  ;		the interrupt flag restored to the entry state on return.      :
  7444                                  ;		only the cmos location and the nmi state is changed.	       :
  7445                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7446                                  
  7447                                  cmos_write:				; write (ah) to location (al)	
  7448 00002343 9C                      		pushf			; write (ah) to location (al)
  7449 00002344 50                      		push	ax		; save work register values
  7450 00002345 FA                      		cli
  7451 00002346 50                      		push	ax		; save user nmi	state
  7452 00002347 0C80                    		or	al, 80h		; disable nmi for us
  7453 00002349 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7454                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7455 0000234B 90                      		nop
  7456 0000234C 88E0                    		mov	al, ah
  7457 0000234E E671                    		out	71h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7458 00002350 58                      		pop	ax		; get user nmi
  7459 00002351 2480                    		and	al, 80h
  7460 00002353 0C0F                    		or	al, 0Fh
  7461 00002355 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  7462                                  					; RTC Seconds
  7463 00002357 90                      		nop
  7464 00002358 E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  7465 0000235A 58                      		pop	ax		; restore work registers
  7466 0000235B 0E                      		push	cs		; *place code segment in stack and
  7467 0000235C E8E3FF                  		call	cmos_popf	; *handle popf for b- level 80286
  7468 0000235F C3                      		retn
  7469                                  
  7470                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7471                                  ; MSINIT.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  7472                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7473                                  ; The following routines provide support for reading in the file MSDOS.SYS.
  7474                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7475                                  
  7476                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7477                                  ;
  7478                                  ; (For Retro DOS, 'IO.SYS' and 'MSDOS.SYS' are already loaded together
  7479                                  ;  at once -as single kernel file- by the Retro DOS boot sector code.
  7480                                  ;  So, following disk reads -MSDOS.SYS loading- is not needed!
  7481                                  ;  Only needing is to move MSDOS Kernel to it's final memory location.) 
  7482                                  
  7483                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7484                                  
  7485                                  ; GetClus, read in a cluster at a specified address
  7486                                  ;
  7487                                  ;  bx = cluster to read
  7488                                  ;  cx = sectors per cluster
  7489                                  ;  es:di = load location
  7490                                  
  7491                                  ; 17/10/2022
  7492                                  ;DISKRD equ diskrd - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h	; (8E5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7493                                  ; 09/12/2022
  7494                                  DISKRD equ diskrd
  7495                                  
  7496                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7497                                  getclus:				
  7498 00002360 51                      		push	cx
  7499 00002361 57                      		push	di
  7500 00002362 2E890E[D016]            		mov	[cs:doscnt], cx
  7501 00002367 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  7502 00002369 48                      		dec	ax
  7503 0000236A 48                      		dec	ax
  7504 0000236B F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to logical sector
  7505                                  					; dx:ax	= matching logical sector number
  7506                                  					;	  starting from the data sector
  7507 0000236D 2E0306[CC16]            		add	ax, [cs:bios_l]
  7508 00002372 2E1316[CE16]            		adc	dx, [cs:bios_h]	; dx:ax	= first	logical	sector to read
  7509                                  unpack:					
  7510 00002377 1E                      		push	ds
  7511 00002378 50                      		push	ax
  7512 00002379 53                      		push	bx
  7513 0000237A 2E8B36[D316]            		mov	si, [cs:fatloc]
  7514 0000237F 8EDE                    		mov	ds, si
  7515 00002381 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; next cluster
  7516 00002383 2EF606[D216]40          		test	byte [cs:fbigfat], 40h	; fbig
  7517                                  					; 16 bit fat?
  7518 00002389 753C                    		jnz	short unpack16	; yes
  7519 0000238B D1EE                    		shr	si, 1		; 12 bit fat. si=si/2
  7520                                  					; si = clus + clus/2
  7521 0000238D 01DE                    		add	si, bx		;
  7522                                  					; (si =	byte offset of the cluster in the FAT)
  7523 0000238F 52                      		push	dx
  7524 00002390 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7525 00002392 E87C00                  		call	get_fat_sector
  7526 00002395 5A                      		pop	dx
  7527 00002396 8B07                    		mov	ax, [bx]	; save it into ax
  7528 00002398 7517                    		jnz	short even_odd	; if not a splitted fat, check even-odd.
  7529                                  		; 25/06/2023
  7530                                  		;mov	al, [bx]	; splitted fat
  7531 0000239A 2EA2[DA16]              		mov	[cs:temp_cluster], al
  7532 0000239E 46                      		inc	si		; (next	byte)
  7533 0000239F 52                      		push	dx
  7534 000023A0 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7535 000023A2 E86C00                  		call	get_fat_sector
  7536 000023A5 5A                      		pop	dx
  7537                                  		;mov	al, ds:0
  7538 000023A6 A00000                  		mov	al, [0] ; 19/10/2022
  7539 000023A9 2EA2[DB16]              		mov	[cs:temp_cluster+1], al
  7540 000023AD 2EA1[DA16]              		mov	ax, [cs:temp_cluster]
  7541                                  even_odd:				
  7542 000023B1 5B                      		pop	bx		; restore old fat entry	value
  7543 000023B2 53                      		push	bx		; save it right	away.
  7544 000023B3 D1EB                    		shr	bx, 1		; was it even or odd?
  7545 000023B5 7308                    		jnb	short havclus	; it was even.
  7546 000023B7 D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1		; odd. massage fat value and keep
  7547                                  					; the highest 12 bits.
  7548 000023B9 D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1
  7549 000023BB D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1
  7550 000023BD D1E8                    		shr	ax, 1
  7551                                  havclus:				
  7552 000023BF 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax		; now bx = new fat entry.
  7553 000023C1 81E3FF0F                		and	bx, 0FFFh	; keep low 12 bits.
  7554 000023C5 EB0E                    		jmp	short unpackx
  7555                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7556                                  
  7557                                  unpack16:				
  7558 000023C7 52                      		push	dx
  7559 000023C8 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  7560 000023CA D1E6                    		shl	si, 1		; extend to 32 bit offset
  7561 000023CC 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  7562 000023CF E83F00                  		call	get_fat_sector
  7563 000023D2 5A                      		pop	dx
  7564 000023D3 8B1F                    		mov	bx, [bx]	;
  7565                                  					; bx = new fat entry.
  7566                                  unpackx:				
  7567 000023D5 5E                      		pop	si		; restore old bx value into si
  7568 000023D6 58                      		pop	ax		; restore logical sector (low)
  7569 000023D7 1F                      		pop	ds
  7570 000023D8 29DE                    		sub	si, bx
  7571 000023DA 83FEFF                  		cmp	si, -1		; one apart?
  7572 000023DD 7507                    		jnz	short getcl2
  7573 000023DF 2E010E[D016]            		add	[cs:doscnt], cx
  7574 000023E4 EB91                    		jmp	short unpack
  7575                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7576                                  
  7577                                  getcl2:					
  7578 000023E6 53                      		push	bx
  7579 000023E7 52                      		push	dx		; sector to read (high)
  7580 000023E8 50                      		push	ax		; sector to read (low)
  7581 000023E9 2EA1[CA16]              		mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]	; get drive and	fat spec
  7582 000023ED 2E8B0E[D016]            		mov	cx, [cs:doscnt]
  7583 000023F2 5A                      		pop	dx		; sector to read for diskrd (low)
  7584 000023F3 2E8F06[2B05]            		pop	word [cs:start_sec_h]
  7585                                  					; sector to read for diskrd (high)
  7586 000023F8 1E                      		push	ds
  7587 000023F9 0E                      		push	cs
  7588 000023FA 1F                      		pop	ds
  7589 000023FB 0E                      		push	cs		; simulate far call
  7590                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7591 000023FC BD[C508]                		mov	bp, DISKRD	; 8E5h
  7592                                  		;mov	bp, 8E5h	; offset diskrd
  7593                                  					; 2C7h:8E5h = 70h:2E55h
  7594 000023FF E863F3                  		call	call_bios_code	; read the clusters
  7595 00002402 1F                      		pop	ds
  7596 00002403 5B                      		pop	bx
  7597 00002404 5F                      		pop	di
  7598 00002405 2EA1[D016]              		mov	ax, [cs:doscnt]	; get number of	sectors	read
  7599 00002409 86E0                    		xchg	ah, al		; multiply by 256
  7600 0000240B D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; times	2 equal	512
  7601 0000240D 01C7                    		add	di, ax		; update load location
  7602 0000240F 59                      		pop	cx		; restore sectors/cluster
  7603 00002410 C3                      		retn
  7604                                  
  7605                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7606                                  
  7607                                  
  7608                                  ;function: find and read the corresponding fat sector into ds:0
  7609                                  ;
  7610                                  ;in). dx:si - offset value (starting from fat entry 0) of fat entry to find. M054
  7611                                  ;     ds - fatloc segment
  7612                                  ;     cs:drvfat - logical drive number, fat id
  7613                                  ;     cs:md_sectorsize
  7614                                  ;     cs:last_fat_secnum - last fat sector number read in.
  7615                                  ;
  7616                                  ;out). corresponding fat sector read in.
  7617                                  ;      bx = offset value from fatlog segment.
  7618                                  ;      other registera saved.
  7619                                  ;      zero flag set if the fat entry is splitted, i.e., when 12 bit fat entry
  7620                                  ;      starts at the last byte of the fat sector. in this case, the caller
  7621                                  ;      should save this byte, and read the next fat sector to get the rest
  7622                                  ;      of the fat entry value. (this will only happen with the 12 bit fat.)
  7623                                  
  7624                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7625                                  get_fat_sector:	
  7626 00002411 50                      		push	ax
  7627 00002412 51                      		push	cx
  7628 00002413 57                      		push	di
  7629 00002414 56                      		push	si
  7630 00002415 06                      		push	es
  7631 00002416 1E                      		push	ds
  7632 00002417 89F0                    		mov	ax, si
  7633 00002419 2E8B0E[D816]            		mov	cx, [cs:md_sectorsize] ; 512
  7634 0000241E F7F1                    		div	cx		; ax = sector number, dx = offset
  7635 00002420 90                      		nop
  7636                                  
  7637                                  		; Get rid of the assumption that
  7638                                  		; there	is only	one reserved sector
  7639                                  
  7640 00002421 06                      		push	es
  7641 00002422 1E                      		push	ds
  7642 00002423 57                      		push	di
  7643 00002424 50                      		push	ax
  7644 00002425 0E                      		push	cs
  7645 00002426 1F                      		pop	ds
  7646                                  
  7647 00002427 2EA1[CA16]              		mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]	; get drive # and FAT id
  7648 0000242B BD[CB04]                		mov	bp, SETDRIVE
  7649                                  		;mov	bp, 4D7h	; setdrive
  7650                                  					; at 2C7h:4D7h = 70h:2A47h
  7651 0000242E 0E                      		push	cs		; simulate far call
  7652 0000242F E833F3                  		call	call_bios_code	; get bds for drive
  7653 00002432 58                      		pop	ax		; (sector number -without reserved and hidden sectors-)
  7654 00002433 26034509                		add	ax, [es:di+9]	; [es:di+BDS.resectors]
  7655                                  					; add #reserved_sectors
  7656 00002437 5F                      		pop	di
  7657 00002438 1F                      		pop	ds
  7658 00002439 07                      		pop	es
  7659 0000243A 2E3B06[DC16]            		cmp	ax, [cs:last_fat_sec_num]
  7660 0000243F 742A                    		jz	short gfs_split_chk ; don't need to read it again.
  7661 00002441 2EA3[DC16]              		mov	[cs:last_fat_sec_num], ax 
  7662                                  					; sector number
  7663                                  					; (in the partition, without hidden sectors)
  7664 00002445 52                      		push	dx
  7665 00002446 2EC706[2B05]0000        		mov	word [cs:start_sec_h], 0 
  7666                                  					; prepare to read the fat sector
  7667                                  					; start_sec_h is always	0 for fat sector.
  7668 0000244D 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax
  7669 0000244F B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; 1 sector read
  7670 00002452 2EA1[CA16]              		mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]
  7671 00002456 1E                      		push	ds
  7672 00002457 07                      		pop	es
  7673 00002458 31FF                    		xor	di, di		; es:di	-> fatloc segment:0
  7674 0000245A 1E                      		push	ds
  7675 0000245B 0E                      		push	cs
  7676 0000245C 1F                      		pop	ds
  7677 0000245D 0E                      		push	cs		; simulate far call
  7678 0000245E BD[C508]                		mov	bp, DISKRD	; 8E5h
  7679                                  		;mov	bp, 8E5h	; offset diskrd
  7680                                  					; 2C7h:8E5h = 70h:2E55h
  7681 00002461 E801F3                  		call	call_bios_code
  7682 00002464 1F                      		pop	ds
  7683 00002465 5A                      		pop	dx
  7684 00002466 2E8B0E[D816]            		mov	cx, [cs:md_sectorsize] ; 512
  7685                                  
  7686                                  gfs_split_chk:				
  7687 0000246B 49                      		dec	cx		; 511
  7688 0000246C 39CA                    		cmp	dx, cx		; if offset points to the
  7689                                  					; last byte of this sector,
  7690                                  					; then splitted	entry.
  7691 0000246E 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; set bx to dx
  7692 00002470 1F                      		pop	ds
  7693 00002471 07                      		pop	es
  7694 00002472 5E                      		pop	si
  7695 00002473 5F                      		pop	di
  7696 00002474 59                      		pop	cx
  7697 00002475 58                      		pop	ax
  7698 00002476 C3                      		retn
  7699                                  
  7700                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7701                                  ;Bios_Data_Init	ends
  7702                                  
  7703                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7704                                  
  7705                                  		; 09/12/2022
  7706                                  		;db 0
  7707                                  
  7708                                  numbertodiv	equ ($-BData_start)
  7709                                  numbertomod	equ (numbertodiv % 16)
  7710                                  
  7711                                  %if numbertomod>0 & numbertomod<16
  7712 00002477 00<rep 9h>              		times (16-numbertomod) db 0
  7713                                  %endif
  7714                                  
  7715                                  ;align 16
  7716                                  
  7717                                  ; 09/12/2022
  7718                                  IOSYSCODESEGOFF	equ $ - BData_start
  7719                                  IOSYSCODESEG	equ (IOSYSCODESEGOFF>>4)+(700h>>4)
  7720                                  
  7721                                  ;--- End of DOSBIOS data segment --------------------------------------------
  7722                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7723                                  		;db 4 dup(0)
  7724                                  ; 09/12/2022		
  7725                                  ;		times 4 db 0	; 19/10/2022
  7726                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7727                                  
  7728                                  ;============================================================================
  7729                                  ; DOS BIOS (IO.SYS) CODE SEGMENT 
  7730                                  ;============================================================================
  7731                                  ; 09/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7732                                  
  7733                                  section .BIOSCODE vstart=0  
  7734                                  
  7735                                  BCode_start:	 ; 09/12/2022
  7736                                   
  7737                                  ; 02/10/2022
  7738                                  
  7739                                  ;--- DOSBIOS code segment ---------------------------------------------------
  7740                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7741                                  ; MSBIO1.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
  7742                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7743                                  
  7744                                  DOSBIOSEG_2C7h:	;db 30h dup(0)		; SEGMENT 2C7h (2C70h-700h=2570h)
  7745 00000000 00<rep 30h>             		times 48 db 0		; 19/10/2022	
  7746 00000030 7000                    BiosDataWord:	dw 70h
  7747                                  
  7748                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7749                                  ;BIOSDATAWORD	equ BiosDataWord - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
  7750                                  ; 09/12/2022
  7751                                  BIOSDATAWORD	equ BiosDataWord
  7752                                  
  7753                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7754                                  
  7755                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS) 
  7756                                  
  7757                                  ;************************************************************************
  7758                                  ;*									*
  7759                                  ;*	seg_reinit is called with ax = our new code segment value,	*
  7760                                  ;*	  trashes di, cx, es						*
  7761                                  ;*									*
  7762                                  ;*	cas -- should be made disposable!				*
  7763                                  ;*									*
  7764                                  ;************************************************************************
  7765                                  
  7766                                  _seg_reinit:
  7767 00000032 2E8E06[3000]            		mov	es, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
  7768                                  					; at 2C7h:30h or 70h:25A0h
  7769                                  		;mov	di, (offset cdev+2)
  7770 00000037 BF[E006]                		mov	di, cdev+2	; 19/10/2022
  7771 0000003A B90400                  		mov	cx, 4		; (end_BC_entries - cdev)/4
  7772                                  
  7773                                  _seg_reinit_1:				
  7774 0000003D AB                      		stosw			; modify Bios_Code entry points
  7775 0000003E 47                      		inc	di
  7776 0000003F 47                      		inc	di
  7777 00000040 E2FB                    		loop	_seg_reinit_1
  7778 00000042 CB                      		retf
  7779                                  
  7780                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7781                                  
  7782                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7783                                  
  7784                                  ;************************************************************************
  7785                                  ;*									*
  7786                                  ;*	chardev_entry - main device driver dispatch routine		*
  7787                                  ;*	   called with a dummy parameter block on the stack		*
  7788                                  ;*	   dw dispatch_table, dw prn/aux numbers (optional)		*
  7789                                  ;*									*
  7790                                  ;*	will eventually take care of doing the transitions in		*
  7791                                  ;*	   out of Bios_Code						*
  7792                                  ;*									*
  7793                                  ;************************************************************************
  7794                                  
  7795                                  chardev_entry:				; 0070h:25B3h =	02C7h:0043h
  7796 00000043 56                      		push	si
  7797 00000044 50                      		push	ax
  7798 00000045 51                      		push	cx
  7799 00000046 52                      		push	dx
  7800 00000047 57                      		push	di
  7801 00000048 55                      		push	bp
  7802 00000049 1E                      		push	ds
  7803 0000004A 06                      		push	es
  7804 0000004B 53                      		push	bx
  7805 0000004C 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
  7806 0000004E 8B7612                  		mov	si, [bp+18]	; get return address (dispatch table)
  7807                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
  7808                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
  7809 00000051 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
  7810 00000056 8B4402                  		mov	ax, [si+2]	; get the device number	if present
  7811 00000059 A2[2100]                		mov	[auxnum], al
  7812 0000005C 8826[E704]              		mov	[printdev], ah
  7813 00000060 8B34                    		mov	si, [si]	; point	to the device dispatch table
  7814 00000062 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; get pointer to i/o packet
  7815 00000066 268A4701                		mov	al, [es:bx+1]	; [es:bx+unit]	; al = unit code
  7816 0000006A 268A670D                		mov	ah, [es:bx+13]	; [es:bx+media]	; ah = media descrip
  7817 0000006E 268B4F12                		mov	cx, [es:bx+18]	; [es:bx+count]	; cx = count
  7818 00000072 268B5714                		mov	dx, [es:bx+20]	; [es:bx+start]	; dx = start sector
  7819                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7820 00000076 81FE[9604]              		cmp	si, DSKTBL
  7821                                  		;cmp	si, 4A2h	; dsktbl
  7822                                  					; at 2C7h:4A2h = 70h:2A12h
  7823 0000007A 7517                    		jnz	short no_sector32_mapping
  7824                                  
  7825                                  ; Special case for 32-bit start sector number:
  7826                                  ;   if (si==dsktbl) /* if this is a disk device call */
  7827                                  ;      set high 16 bits of secnum to 0
  7828                                  ;      if (secnum == 0xffff) fetch 32 bit sector number
  7829                                  ;
  7830                                  ; pass high word of sector number in start_sec_h, low word in dx
  7831                                  ;
  7832                                  ; note: start_l and start_h are the offsets within the io_request packet
  7833                                  ;	  which contain the low and hi words of the 32 bit start sector if
  7834                                  ;	  it has been used.
  7835                                  ;
  7836                                  ; note: remember not to destroy the registers which have been set up before
  7837                                  
  7838                                  		;mov	ds:start_sec_h,	0 ; initialize to 0
  7839 0000007C C706[2B05]0000          		mov	word [start_sec_h], 0
  7840 00000082 83FAFF                  		cmp	dx, 0FFFFh
  7841 00000085 750C                    		jnz	short no_sector32_mapping
  7842 00000087 268B571C                		mov	dx, [es:bx+28]	; [es:bx+start_h]
  7843                                  					; 32 bits dsk req
  7844                                  		;mov	ds:start_sec_h,	dx ; start_sec_h = packet.start_h
  7845 0000008B 8916[2B05]              		mov	[start_sec_h], dx
  7846 0000008F 268B571A                		mov	dx, [es:bx+26]	; [es:bx+start_l]
  7847                                  					; dx = packet.start_l
  7848                                  no_sector32_mapping:			
  7849 00000093 97                      		xchg	ax, di
  7850 00000094 268A4702                		mov	al, [es:bx+2]	; [es:bx+cmd]
  7851 00000098 2E3A04                  		cmp	al, cs:[si]
  7852 0000009B 732C                    		jnb	short command_error
  7853 0000009D 98                      		cbw			; note that al <= 15 means ok
  7854 0000009E D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  7855 000000A0 01C6                    		add	si, ax
  7856 000000A2 97                      		xchg	ax, di
  7857 000000A3 26C47F0E                		les	di, [es:bx+14]	; [es:bx+trans]
  7858 000000A7 FC                      		cld
  7859                                  		; 17/10/2022
  7860 000000A8 2EFF5401                		call	near [cs:si+1]
  7861                                  		;call	word ptr cs:si+1
  7862 000000AC 7202                    		jb	short already_got_ah_status
  7863 000000AE B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  7864                                  already_got_ah_status:
  7865                                  		;;mov	ds, [cs:0030h]	; 15/10/2022			
  7866                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
  7867                                  					; cas note: shouldn't be needed!
  7868 000000B0 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
  7869                                  		;lds	bx, ds:ptrsav
  7870 000000B5 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]
  7871 000000B9 894703                  		mov	[bx+3],	ax	; [bx+status]
  7872                                  					; mark operation complete
  7873 000000BC 5B                      		pop	bx
  7874 000000BD 07                      		pop	es
  7875 000000BE 1F                      		pop	ds
  7876 000000BF 5D                      		pop	bp
  7877 000000C0 5F                      		pop	di
  7878 000000C1 5A                      		pop	dx
  7879 000000C2 59                      		pop	cx
  7880 000000C3 58                      		pop	ax
  7881 000000C4 5E                      		pop	si
  7882 000000C5 83C402                  		add	sp, 2		; get rid of fake return address
  7883                                  	
  7884                                  		; fall through into bc_retf
  7885                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------	
  7886                                  bc_retf:
  7887 000000C8 CB                      		retf
  7888                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7889                                  
  7890                                  command_error:				
  7891 000000C9 E80900                  		call	bc_cmderr
  7892 000000CC EBE2                    		jmp	short already_got_ah_status
  7893                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7894                                  ; 01/05/2019
  7895                                  
  7896                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7897                                  ; The following piece of hack is for supporting CP/M compatibility
  7898                                  ; Basically at offset 5 we have a far call into 0:c0. But this does not call
  7899                                  ; 0:c0 directly instead it call f01d:fef0, because it needs to support 'lhld 6'
  7900                                  ; The following hack has to reside at ffff:d0 (= f01d:fef0) if BIOS is loaded
  7901                                  ; high.
  7902                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7903                                  
  7904                                  		;db 7 dup(0)
  7905                                  
  7906                                  		; 15/10/2022
  7907                                  
  7908 000000CE 0000                    		dw 0		; pad to bring offset to 0D0h
  7909                                  
  7910 000000D0 00<rep 5h>              off_d0: 	times 5 db 0	; 5 bytes from 0:c0 will be copied onto here
  7911                                  				;  which is the CP/M call 5 entry point
  7912                                  		
  7913                                  
  7914                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7915                                  
  7916                                  ;	exit - all routines return through this path
  7917                                  
  7918                                  bc_cmderr:				
  7919 000000D5 B003                    		mov	al, 3		; 2C7h:D5h = 70h:2645h
  7920                                  					; unknown command error
  7921                                  
  7922                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  7923                                  
  7924                                  ;	now zero the count field by subtracting its current value,
  7925                                  ;	  which is still in cx, from itself.
  7926                                  
  7927                                  ;	subtract the number of i/o's NOT YET COMPLETED from total
  7928                                  ;	  in order to return the number actually complete
  7929                                  
  7930                                  bc_err_cnt:	
  7931                                  		;les	bx, ds:ptrsav
  7932                                  		; 19/10/2022
  7933 000000D7 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
  7934 000000DB 26294F12                		sub	[es:bx+18], cx	; [es:bx+count]
  7935                                  					; # of successful i/o's
  7936 000000DF B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; mark error return
  7937 000000E1 F9                      		stc			; indicate abnormal end
  7938 000000E2 C3                      		retn
  7939                                  
  7940                                  ; 15/10/2022
  7941                                  
  7942                                  ;Bios_Code ends
  7943                                  
  7944                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7945                                  ; MSCHAR.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
  7946                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  7947                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  7948                                  ; 10/01/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  7949                                  
  7950                                  ; 30/04/2019
  7951                                  
  7952                                  ;title	mschar - character and clock devices
  7953                                  
  7954                                  ;MODE_CTRLBRK	equ	0FFh
  7955                                  
  7956                                  ; BIOSCODE:00E4h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  7957                                  
  7958                                  ;************************************************************************
  7959                                  ;*									*
  7960                                  ;*	device driver dispatch tables					*
  7961                                  ;*									*
  7962                                  ;*	each table starts with a byte which lists the number of		*
  7963                                  ;*	legal functions, followed by that number of words. Each		*
  7964                                  ;*	word represents an offset of a routine in Bios_Code which	*
  7965                                  ;*	handles the function. The functions are terminated with		*
  7966                                  ;*	a near return. If carry is reset, a 'done' code is returned	*
  7967                                  ;*	to the caller. If carry is set, the ah/al registers are		*
  7968                                  ;*	returned as abnormal completion status. Notice that ds		*
  7969                                  ;*	is assumed to point to the Bios_Data segment throughout.	*
  7970                                  ;*									*
  7971                                  ;************************************************************************
  7972                                  
  7973                                  		; 13/12/2022
  7974                                  		;db 0
  7975                                  
  7976                                  		; 13/12/202
  7977 000000E3 0B                      con_table:	db ((con_table_end - con_table)-1)/2 ; 11
  7978                                  					; 2C7h:0E4h = 70h:2654h
  7979 000000E4 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec  ; 1FBh	; bc_exvec at 2C7h:1FBh	= 70h:276Bh
  7980                                  					; 00 init
  7981 000000E6 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec  ; 1FBh	; 01
  7982 000000E8 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec  ; 1FBh	; 02
  7983 000000EA [D500]                  		dw bc_cmderr ; 0D5h	; bc_exvec at 2C7h:D5h = 70h:2645h
  7984                                  					; 03
  7985 000000EC [5B01]                  		dw con_read  ; 15Ch	; con_read at 2C7h:15Ch	= 70h:26CCh
  7986                                  					; 04
  7987 000000EE [9E01]                  		dw con_rdnd  ; 19Fh	; con_rdnd at 2C7h:19Fh	= 70h:270Fh
  7988                                  					; 05
  7989 000000F0 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec  ; 1FBh	; 06
  7990 000000F2 [0702]                  		dw con_flush ; 209h	; con_flush at 2C7h:209h = 70h:2779h
  7991                                  					; 07
  7992 000000F4 [FB01]                  		dw con_writ  ; 1FDh	; con_writ at 2C7h:1FDh	= 70h:276Dh
  7993                                  					; 08
  7994 000000F6 [FB01]                  		dw con_writ  ; 1FDh	; 09
  7995 000000F8 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec  ; 1FBh	; 0A
  7996                                  con_table_end:
  7997 000000FA 1A                      prn_table:	db ((prn_table_end - prn_table)-1)/2 ; 26			
  7998                                  					; 2C7h:0FBh = 70h:266Bh
  7999 000000FB [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; bc_exvec
  8000 000000FD [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 01
  8001 000000FF [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 02
  8002 00000101 [D500]                  		dw bc_cmderr  ;	0D5h	; bc_cmderr
  8003 00000103 [1802]                  		dw prn_input  ;	21Ah	; prn_input
  8004                                  					; 04 indicate zero chars read
  8005 00000105 [C601]                  		dw z_bus_exit ; 1C8h	; z_bus_exit
  8006                                  					; 05 read non-destructive
  8007 00000107 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 06
  8008 00000109 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 07
  8009 0000010B [1D02]                  		dw prn_writ   ;	21Fh	; prn_writ
  8010 0000010D [1D02]                  		dw prn_writ   ; 21Fh	; 09
  8011 0000010F [4E02]                  		dw prn_stat   ; 251h	; prn_stat
  8012 00000111 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 0B
  8013 00000113 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 0C
  8014 00000115 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 0D
  8015 00000117 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 0E
  8016 00000119 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 0F
  8017 0000011B [8802]                  		dw prn_tilbusy ; 28Bh	; prn_tilbusy
  8018 0000011D [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 11
  8019 0000011F [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 12
  8020 00000121 [B602]                  		dw prn_genioctl ; 2BAh	; prn_genioctl
  8021 00000123 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 14
  8022 00000125 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 15
  8023 00000127 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 16
  8024 00000129 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 17
  8025 0000012B [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 18
  8026 0000012D [EB02]                  		dw prn_ioctl_query ; 2F0h ; prn_ioctl_query
  8027                                  prn_table_end:
  8028 0000012F 0B                      aux_table:	db ((aux_table_end - aux_table)-1)/2 ; 11			
  8029                                  					; 2C7h:130h = 70h:26A0h
  8030 00000130 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 00 - init
  8031 00000132 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 01
  8032 00000134 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 02
  8033 00000136 [D500]                  		dw bc_cmderr  ;	0D5h	; 03
  8034 00000138 [0603]                  		dw aux_read   ; 30Dh	; aux_read ; 04	- read
  8035 0000013A [2D03]                  		dw aux_rdnd   ; 335h	; aux_rdnd - 05	- read non-destructive
  8036 0000013C [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 06
  8037 0000013E [6303]                  		dw aux_flsh   ;	36Ch	; aux_flsh
  8038 00000140 [6A03]                  		dw aux_writ   ;	374h	; aux_writ
  8039 00000142 [6A03]                  		dw aux_writ   ;	374h	; 09
  8040 00000144 [4D03]                  		dw aux_wrst   ;	355h	; aux_wrst
  8041                                  aux_table_end:
  8042 00000146 0A                      tim_table	db ((tim_table_end - tim_table)-1)/2 ; 10
  8043                                  					; 2C7h:147h = 70h:26B7h
  8044 00000147 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 00
  8045 00000149 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 01
  8046 0000014B [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 02
  8047 0000014D [D500]                  		dw bc_cmderr  ;	0D5h	; 03
  8048 0000014F [2904]                  		dw tim_read   ;	435h	; tim_read
  8049 00000151 [C601]                  		dw z_bus_exit ; 1C8h	; z_bus_exit
  8050 00000153 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 06
  8051 00000155 [F901]                  		dw bc_exvec   ; 1FBh	; 07
  8052 00000157 [D003]                  		dw tim_writ   ; 3DBh	; tim_writ
  8053 00000159 [D003]                  		dw tim_writ   ; 3DBh	; 09
  8054                                  tim_table_end:
  8055                                  
  8056                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8057                                  
  8058                                  ;************************************************************************
  8059                                  ;*									*
  8060                                  ;*	con_read - read cx bytes from keyboard into buffer at es:di	*
  8061                                  ;*									*
  8062                                  ;************************************************************************
  8063                                  
  8064                                  con_read:				; 2C7h:15Ch = 70h:26CCh
  8065                                  		;jcxz	short con_exit	; read cx bytes	from keyboard into buffer
  8066 0000015B E306                    		jcxz	con_exit	; 19/10/2022
  8067                                  con_loop:				
  8068 0000015D E80500                  		call	chrin		; get char in al
  8069 00000160 AA                      		stosb			; store	char at	es:di
  8070 00000161 E2FA                    		loop	con_loop
  8071                                  con_exit:				
  8072 00000163 F8                      		clc
  8073 00000164 C3                      		retn
  8074                                  
  8075                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8076                                  
  8077                                  ;************************************************************************
  8078                                  ;*									*
  8079                                  ;*	chrin - input single char from keyboard into al			*
  8080                                  ;*									*
  8081                                  ;*	  we are going to issue extended keyboard function, if		*
  8082                                  ;*	  supported. the returning value of the extended keystroke	*
  8083                                  ;*	  of the extended keyboard function uses 0E0h in al		*
  8084                                  ;*	  instead of 00h as in the conventional keyboard function.	*
  8085                                  ;*	  this creates a conflict when the user entered real		*
  8086                                  ;*	  greek alpha charater (= 0E0h) to  distinguish the extended	*
  8087                                  ;*	  keystroke and the greek alpha. this case will be handled	*
  8088                                  ;*	  in the following manner:					*
  8089                                  ;*									*
  8090                                  ;*	      ah = 16h							*
  8091                                  ;*	      int 16h							*
  8092                                  ;*	      if al == 0, then extended code (in ah)			*
  8093                                  ;*	      else if al == 0E0h, then					*
  8094                                  ;*	      if ah <> 0, then extended code (in ah)			*
  8095                                  ;*		else greek_alpha character.				*
  8096                                  ;*									*
  8097                                  ;*	also, for compatibility reason, if an extended code is		*
  8098                                  ;*	  detected, then we are going to change the value in al		*
  8099                                  ;*	  from 0E0h to 00h.						*
  8100                                  ;*									*
  8101                                  ;************************************************************************
  8102                                  
  8103                                  		; 19/10/2022
  8104                                  chrin:		
  8105 00000165 8A26[E504]              		mov	ah, [keyrd_func] ; set by msinit. 0 or 10h
  8106 00000169 30C0                    		xor	al, al
  8107 0000016B 8606[0C00]              		xchg	al, [altah]	; get character	& zero altah
  8108 0000016F 08C0                    		or	al, al
  8109 00000171 752A                    		jnz	short keyret
  8110 00000173 CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD -
  8111 00000175 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
  8112 00000177 74EC                    		jz	short chrin
  8113 00000179 3D0072                  		cmp	ax, 7200h	; check	for ctrl-prtsc
  8114 0000017C 7504                    		jnz	short alt_ext_chk
  8115 0000017E B010                    		mov	al, 10h
  8116 00000180 EB1B                    		jmp	short keyret
  8117                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8118                                  
  8119                                  ;  if operation was extended function (i.e. keyrd_func != 0) then
  8120                                  ;    if character read was 0E0h then
  8121                                  ;      if extended byte was zero (i.e. ah == 0) then
  8122                                  ;	 goto keyret
  8123                                  ;      else
  8124                                  ;	 set al to zero
  8125                                  ;	 goto alt_save
  8126                                  ;      endif
  8127                                  ;    endif
  8128                                  ;  endif
  8129                                  
  8130                                  alt_ext_chk:
  8131 00000182 803E[E504]00            		cmp	byte [keyrd_func], 0
  8132 00000187 740C                    		jz	short not_ext
  8133 00000189 3CE0                    		cmp	al, 0E0h
  8134 0000018B 7508                    		jnz	short not_ext
  8135 0000018D 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
  8136 0000018F 740C                    		jz	short keyret
  8137 00000191 30C0                    		xor	al, al
  8138 00000193 EB04                    		jmp	short alt_save
  8139                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8140                                  
  8141                                  not_ext:				
  8142 00000195 08C0                    		or	al, al		; special case?
  8143 00000197 7504                    		jnz	short keyret
  8144                                  alt_save:				
  8145 00000199 8826[0C00]              		mov	[altah], ah	; store	special	key
  8146                                  keyret:					
  8147 0000019D C3                      		retn
  8148                                  
  8149                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8150                                  
  8151                                  ;************************************************************************
  8152                                  ;*									*
  8153                                  ;*	con_rdnd - keyboard non destructive read, no wait		*
  8154                                  ;*									*
  8155                                  ;*	pc-convertible-type machine: if bit 10 is set by the dos	*
  8156                                  ;*	in the status word of the request packet, and there is no	*
  8157                                  ;*	character in the input buffer, the driver issues a system	*
  8158                                  ;*	wait request to the rom. on return from the rom, it returns	*
  8159                                  ;*	a 'char-not-found' to the dos.					*
  8160                                  ;*									*
  8161                                  ;************************************************************************
  8162                                  
  8163                                  		; 19/10/2022
  8164                                  con_rdnd:				
  8165 0000019E A0[0C00]                		mov	al, [altah]
  8166 000001A1 08C0                    		or	al, al
  8167 000001A3 754C                    		jnz	short rdexit
  8168 000001A5 8A26[E604]              		mov	ah, [keysts_func]
  8169 000001A9 CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD -
  8170 000001AB 751D                    		jnz	short gotchr
  8171 000001AD 803E[7900]00            		cmp	byte [fhavek09], 0
  8172 000001B2 7412                    		jz	short z_bus_exit
  8173 000001B4 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
  8174                                  		; 12/12/2022
  8175 000001B8 26F6470404              		test	byte [es:bx+4], 04h
  8176                                  		;test	word [es:bx+3], 400h ; [es:bx+status]
  8177 000001BD 7407                    		jz	short z_bus_exit
  8178 000001BF B80041                  		mov	ax, 4100h
  8179 000001C2 30DB                    		xor	bl, bl
  8180 000001C4 CD15                    		int	15h		; SYSTEM - WAIT	ON EXTERNAL EVENT (CONVERTIBLE)
  8181                                  					; AL = condition type, BH = condition compare or mask value
  8182                                  					; BL = timeout value times 55 milliseconds, 00h	means no timeout
  8183                                  					; DX = I/O port	address	if AL bit 4 set
  8184                                  z_bus_exit:				
  8185 000001C6 F9                      		stc			; 2C7h:1C8h = 70h:2738h
  8186 000001C7 B403                    		mov	ah, 3		; indicate busy	status
  8187 000001C9 C3                      		retn
  8188                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8189                                  
  8190                                  gotchr:					
  8191 000001CA 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
  8192 000001CC 7508                    		jnz	short notbrk	; check	for null after break
  8193 000001CE 8A26[E504]              		mov	ah, [keyrd_func] ; issue keyboard read function
  8194 000001D2 CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD -
  8195 000001D4 EBC8                    		jmp	short con_rdnd	; get a	real status
  8196                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8197                                  
  8198                                  notbrk:					
  8199 000001D6 3D0072                  		cmp	ax, 7200h	; check	for ctrl-prtsc
  8200 000001D9 7504                    		jnz	short rd_ext_chk
  8201 000001DB B010                    		mov	al, 10h		; ('P' & 1Fh) ; return control p
  8202 000001DD EB12                    		jmp	short rdexit
  8203                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8204                                  
  8205                                  rd_ext_chk:				
  8206 000001DF 803E[E504]00            		cmp	byte [keyrd_func], 0 ; extended keyboard function?
  8207 000001E4 740B                    		jz	short rdexit
  8208 000001E6 3CE0                    		cmp	al, 0E0h	; extended key value or	greek alpha?
  8209 000001E8 7507                    		jnz	short rdexit
  8210 000001EA 80FC00                  		cmp	ah, 0		; scan code exist?
  8211 000001ED 7402                    		jz	short rdexit	; yes. greek alpha char.
  8212 000001EF B000                    		mov	al, 0		; no. extended key stroke.
  8213                                  					; change it for	compatibility
  8214                                  rdexit:					
  8215 000001F1 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]
  8216 000001F5 2688470D                		mov	[es:bx+13], al	; [es:bx+media]
  8217                                  					; return keyboard character here
  8218                                  bc_exvec:				
  8219 000001F9 F8                      		clc			; bc_exvec at 2C7h:1FBh	= 70h:276Bh
  8220                                  					; indicate normal termination
  8221 000001FA C3                      		retn
  8222                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8223                                  
  8224                                  ;************************************************************************
  8225                                  ;*									*
  8226                                  ;*	con_write - console write routine				*
  8227                                  ;*									*
  8228                                  ;*	entry:	es:di -> buffer						*
  8229                                  ;*		cx    =  count						*
  8230                                  ;*									*
  8231                                  ;************************************************************************
  8232                                  
  8233                                  con_writ:

  8235 000001FB E3FC                    		jcxz	bc_exvec	; 19/10/2022

  8240 00000200 47                      		inc	di
  8241 00000201 CD29                    		int	29h		; DOS 2+ internal - FAST PUTCHAR
  8242                                  					; AL = character to display
  8243 00000203 E2F8                    		loop	con_lp
  8244                                  cc_ret:					
  8245 00000205 F8                      		clc

  8247                                  
  8248                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================

  8250                                  ;************************************************************************
  8251                                  ;*									*
  8252                                  ;*	con_flush - flush out keyboard queue				*
  8253                                  ;*									*
  8254                                  ;************************************************************************
  8255                                  
  8256                                  con_flush:
  8257 00000207 C606[0C00]00            		mov	byte [altah], 0	; clear	out holding buffer
  8258                                  flloop:					; while	(charavail()) charread();	
  8259 0000020C B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  8260 0000020E CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD - CHECK BUFFER, DO NOT CLEAR
  8261                                  					; Return: ZF clear if character	in buffer
  8262                                  					; AH = scan code, AL = character
  8263                                  					; ZF set if no character in buffer
  8264 00000210 74F3                    		jz	short cc_ret
  8265 00000212 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  8266 00000214 CD16                    		int	16h		; KEYBOARD - READ CHAR FROM BUFFER, WAIT IF EMPTY
  8267                                  					; Return: AH = scan code, AL = character
  8268 00000216 EBF4                    		jmp	short flloop
  8269

  8271                                  
  8272                                  ; 15/10/2022
