  9800                                  
  9801                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9802                                  
  9803                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9804                                  
  9805                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9806                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
  9807                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
  9808                                  ;
  9809                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
  9810                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9811                                  
  9812                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9813                                  
  9814                                  readbootsec:	
  9815 000006AC B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
  9816 000006AE B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
  9817 000006B1 E8C600                  		call	read_sector
  9818 000006B4 724A                    		jb	short err_ret
  9819 000006B6 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
  9820                                  
  9821                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
  9822                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
  9823                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
  9824                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
  9825                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
  9826                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
  9827                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
  9828                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
  9829                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
  9830                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
  9831                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
  9832                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
  9833                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
  9834                                  		; informations
  9835                                  
  9836                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
  9837                                  
  9838                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9839 000006B8 803E[4E01]69            		cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
  9840 000006BD 7415                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
  9841 000006BF 803E[4E01]E9            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
  9842 000006C4 740E                    		jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
  9843 000006C6 803E[4E01]EB            		cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
  9844 000006CB 7531                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9845 000006CD 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
  9846 000006D2 752A                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9847                                  
  9848                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9849                                  ;
  9850                                  ;; 10/03/2019
  9851                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
  9852                                  ;;
  9853                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
  9854                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
  9855                                  ;;
  9856                                  ;;check_signature:
  9857                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
  9858                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
  9859                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
  9860                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
  9861                                  
  9862                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
  9863                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
  9864                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
  9865                                  
  9866                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9867                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:			
  9868 000006D4 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9869                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  9870 000006D7 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
  9871 000006D9 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
  9872 000006DB 7521                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
  9873                                  
  9874                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
  9875                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
  9876                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
  9877                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
  9878                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
  9879                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
  9880                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
  9881                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
  9882                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
  9883                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
  9884                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
  9885                                  
  9886                                  checksinglesided:
  9887 000006DD A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
  9888 000006E0 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
  9889 000006E2 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
  9890 000006E4 A801                    		test	al, 1
  9891 000006E6 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
  9892 000006E8 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
  9893 000006EE 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
  9894 000006F0 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
  9895 000006F5 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
  9896                                  
  9897                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
  9898                                  
  9899                                  mustbeearlier:				
  9900 000006F7 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
  9901                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  9902 000006FC EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
  9903                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9904                                  
  9905                                  invalidbootsec:				
  9906 000006FE 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
  9907                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9908                                  movbpb_ret:
  9909                                  gooddsk:				
  9910 000006FF F8                      		clc
  9911                                  err_ret:
  9912 00000700 C3                      		retn
  9913                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9914                                  
  9915                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9916                                  ;err_ret:				
  9917                                  		;retn
  9918                                  
  9919                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9920                                  
  9921                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9922                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9923                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
  9924                                  ; getbp routine at has1
  9925                                  ;
  9926                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
  9927                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
  9928                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
  9929                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
  9930                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
  9931                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
  9932                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9933                                  
  9934                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9935                                  
  9936                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9937                                  movbpb:	
  9938 00000701 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
  9939                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
  9940                                  					; sectors per unit
  9941 00000705 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
  9942                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
  9943                                  					; number of directory entries
  9944 00000709 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
  9945                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
  9946                                  					; size of drive
  9947 0000070D 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
  9948                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
  9949                                  					; media	descriptor
  9950 00000711 A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
  9951                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
  9952                                  					; number of fat	sectors
  9953 00000714 8A1E[6601]              		mov	bl, [disksector+18h]
  9954                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
  9955                                  					; sectors per track
  9956 00000718 8A16[6801]              		mov	dl, [disksector+1Ah]
  9957                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.HEADS]
  9958                                  					; number of heads
  9959 0000071C 803E[0A05]01            		cmp	byte [set_id_flag], 1 ; called by get_bpb?
  9960 00000721 75DC                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
  9961 00000723 E81200                  		call	mov_media_ids
  9962 00000726 7205                    		jb	short movbpb_conv ; conventional boot record?
  9963 00000728 C606[0A05]02            		mov	byte [set_id_flag], 2 ; signals that volume id is set
  9964                                  movbpb_conv:				
  9965 0000072D 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1
  9966 00000732 75CB                    		jnz	short movbpb_ret
  9967 00000734 E8D411                  		call	resetchanged	; reset	flags in bds to	not fchanged.
  9968                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9969                                  		; cf = 0
  9970                                  ;movbpb_ret:				
  9971                                  		;clc
  9972 00000737 C3                      		retn
  9973                                  
  9974                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9975                                  
  9976                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
  9977                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
  9978                                  ;by es:di.
  9979                                  
  9980                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
  9981                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.
  9982                                  ;out.) vol_serial, bds_volid and bds_system_id in bds are set according to
  9983                                  ;      the boot record information.
  9984                                  ;     carry flag set if not an extended bpb.
  9985                                  ;     all registers saved except the flag.
  9986                                  
  9987                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9988                                  mov_media_ids:		
  9989 00000738 803E[7401]29            		cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
  9990                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SIG],
  9991                                  					; EXT_BOOT_SIGNATURE
  9992 0000073D 752C                    		jnz	short mmi_not_ext
  9993 0000073F 51                      		push	cx
  9994 00000740 8B0E[7501]              		mov	cx, [disksector+27h]
  9995                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]
  9996 00000744 26894D57                		mov	[es:di+57h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial]
  9997 00000748 8B0E[7701]              		mov	cx, [disksector+29h]
  9998                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]
  9999 0000074C 26894D59                		mov	[es:di+59h], cx	; [es:di+BDS.vol_serial+2]
 10000 00000750 57                      		push	di
 10001 00000751 56                      		push	si
 10002 00000752 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10003 00000755 BE[7901]                		mov	si, disksector+2Bh
 10004                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+2Bh) ;
 10005                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.VOL_LABEL
 10006 00000758 83C74B                  		add	di, 75		; BDS.volid
 10007 0000075B F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10008                                  		;mov	cx, 8		; size_of_EXT_SYSTEM_ID
 10009                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10010 0000075D B108                    		mov	cl, 8 ; cx = 8
 10011 0000075F BE[8401]                		mov	si, disksector+36h
 10012                                  		;mov	si, (offset disksector+36h) ; disksector+EXT_BOOT.SYSTEM_ID
 10013 00000762 83C705                  		add	di, 5		; (BDS.filesys_id-BDS.volid)-size_of_EXT_BOOT_VOL_LABEL
 10014 00000765 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 10015 00000767 5E                      		pop	si
 10016 00000768 5F                      		pop	di
 10017 00000769 59                      		pop	cx
 10018                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10019                                  		; cf = 0
 10020                                  		;clc		; this clc is not required (16/06/2019 - Erdogan Tan)
 10021                                  				; (20/09/2022)
 10022 0000076A C3                      		retn
 10023                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10024                                  
 10025                                  mmi_not_ext:				
 10026 0000076B F9                      		stc
 10027 0000076C C3                      		retn

 10029                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10030                                  
 10031                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10032                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10033                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10034                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10035                                  ; output:
 10036                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 10037                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit
 10038                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10039                                  
 10040                                  readfat:	
 10041                                  		;mov	dh, 0
 10042                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10043 0000076D 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
 10044 0000076F B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
 10045                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
 10046 00000772 E80500                  		call	read_sector
 10047 00000775 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret
 10048 00000777 8A27                    		mov	ah, [bx]	; media	byte
 10049                                  bad_fat_ret:				
 10050 00000779 C3                      		retn
 10051                                  
 10052                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10053                                  
 10054                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10055                                  
 10056                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10057                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10058                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10059                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10060                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10061                                  ;		dh has head
 10062                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10063                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10064                                  ;
 10065                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10066                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10067                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10068                                  ;
 10069                                  ;		carry set
 10070                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10071                                  ;
 10072                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10073                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10074                                  
 10075                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10076                                  
 10077                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10078                                  read_sector:	
 10079 0000077A 55                      		push	bp
 10080 0000077B BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10081 0000077E 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10082 00000782 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10083                                  rd_ret:					
 10084 00000785 06                      		push	es
 10085 00000786 1E                      		push	ds
 10086 00000787 07                      		pop	es
 10087 00000788 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10088 0000078B CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10089                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10090                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10091                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10092 0000078D 07                      		pop	es
 10093 0000078E 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10094                                  rd_rty:					
 10095 00000790 E87604                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10096 00000793 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 10097 00000795 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10098                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10099                                  					; fnon_removable
 10100 0000079A 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 10101 0000079C 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10102 000007A1 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 10103 000007A3 50                      		push	ax
 10104 000007A4 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 10105 000007A5 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10106                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10107                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10108                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 10109                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10110 000007A9 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 10111 000007AB 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 10112                                  		; 
 10113 000007AE 1F                      		pop	ds
 10114 000007AF A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 10115 000007B2 58                      		pop	ax
 10116                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 10117 000007B3 06                      		push	es
 10118 000007B4 1E                      		push	ds
 10119 000007B5 07                      		pop	es
 10120 000007B6 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10121 000007B9 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10122                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10123                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10124                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10125 000007BB 07                      		pop	es
 10126 000007BC 9C                      		pushf
 10127 000007BD 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10128 000007C2 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 10129 000007C4 50                      		push	ax
 10130 000007C5 A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 10131 000007C8 1E                      		push	ds
 10132 000007C9 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10133 000007CD 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10134 000007D0 1F                      		pop	ds
 10135 000007D1 58                      		pop	ax
 10136                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 10137 000007D2 9D                      		popf
 10138 000007D3 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 10139 000007D5 EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 10140                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10141                                  
 10142                                  err_rd_ret:				
 10143 000007D7 B2FF                    		mov	dl, 0FFh	; make sure we ask rom if media	has changed
 10144                                  					; return error
 10145 000007D9 F9                      		stc
 10146                                  
 10147                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 10148                                  ; track accessed in that drive.
 10149                                  
 10150                                  okret2:					
 10151 000007DA 8816[7600]              		mov	[step_drv], dl	; set up for head settle logic in disk
 10152 000007DE 8816[1E01]              		mov	[tim_drv], dl	; save drive last accessed
 10153 000007E2 26886D46                		mov	[es:di+46h], ch	; [es:di+BDS.track]
 10154                                  					; save last track accessed on this drive
 10155                                  					; preserve flags in case error occurred
 10156 000007E6 9C                      		pushf
 10157 000007E7 E8FF03                  		call	set_tim
 10158 000007EA 9D                      		popf			; restore flags
 10159 000007EB 5D                      		pop	bp
 10160 000007EC C3                      		retn

 10166                                  dsk_open:				; 2C7h:80Ah = 70h:2D7Ah

 10253                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10254                                  
 10255                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10256                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines. 
 10257                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 10258                                  
 10259                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 10260                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 10261                                  ;
 10262                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data
 10263                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10264                                  
 10265                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10266                                  checksingle:		
 10267 0000083C 50                      		push	ax
 10268 0000083D 53                      		push	bx
 10269 0000083E 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10270                                  
 10271                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 10272                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 10273                                  
 10274 00000842 F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 10275 00000845 7573                    		jnz	short singleret
 10276 00000847 F6C310                  		test	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 10277                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 10278 0000084A 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 10279                                  
 10280                                  
 10281                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 10282                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 10283                                  
 10284 0000084C 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10285                                  					; get physical drive number
 10286 00000850 06                      		push	es		; preserve pointer to current bds
 10287 00000851 57                      		push	di
 10288 00000852 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 10289                                  scan_list:				
 10290 00000856 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 10291 0000085A 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 10292 0000085C B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 10293 0000085E 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 10294 00000862 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 10295 00000864 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 10296 00000868 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 10297 00000869 07                      		pop	es
 10298 0000086A 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 10299                                  
 10300                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 10301                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 10302                                  ; in this case.
 10303 0000086E 803E[7A00]01            		cmp	byte [fsetowner], 1
 10304 00000873 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner
 10305                                  		;cmp	byte ptr es:[di+4], 0 ;	are we handling	drive number 0 ?
 10306 00000875 26807D0400              		cmp	byte [es:di+4], 0
 10307 0000087A 753E                    		jnz	short singleret
 10308 0000087C 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]
 10309                                  		;mov	al, es:[di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 10310                                  					; get the DOS drive letter
 10311 00000880 06                      		push	es
 10312 00000881 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10313 00000885 26A20405                		mov	[es:LSTDRV], al
 10314                                  		;mov	es:504h, al	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10315                                  					; set up sdsb
 10316 00000889 07                      		pop	es		; restore bds pointer
 10317 0000088A EB2E                    		jmp	short singleret
 10318                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10319                                  
 10320                                  ; to support "backward" compatibility with ibm's "single drive status byte"
 10321                                  ; we now check to see if we are in a single drive system and the application
 10322                                  ; has "cleverly" diddled the sdsb
 10323                                  
 10324                                  not_fsetowner:

 10326 00000891 7517                    		jnz	short ignore_sdsb
 10327 00000893 50                      		push	ax
 10328 00000894 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; if (curr_drv == req_drv)
 10329 00000898 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 10330 0000089A 06                      		push	es
 10331 0000089B 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10332 0000089F 2686060405              		xchg	al, [es:LSTDRV]
 10333                                  		;xchg	al, es:504h	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10334                                  					; then swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10335 000008A4 07                      		pop	es
 10336 000008A5 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; else
 10337 000008A7 58                      		pop	ax		; swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10338 000008A8 7410                    		jz	short singleret	; issue	swap_dsk_msg
 10339                                  ignore_sdsb:				
 10340 000008AA E8800E                  		call	swpdsk
 10341 000008AD EB0B                    		jmp	short singleret
 10342                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10343                                  
 10344                                  scan_skip:	
 10345 000008AF 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]			
 10346                                  		;les	di, es:[di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 10347                                  					; go to	next bds
 10348 000008B2 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; end of list?
 10349 000008B5 759F                    		jnz	short scan_list	; ontinue until	hit end	of list
 10350 000008B7 F9                      		stc
 10351 000008B8 5F                      		pop	di		; restore current bds
 10352 000008B9 07                      		pop	es
 10353

 10356 000008BB 58                      		pop	ax
 10357 000008BC C3                      		retn

 10377                                  ; 15/10/52022
 10378                                  
 10379                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10380                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 10381                                  ;
 10382                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 10383                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 10384                                  ;	cx = sector count
 10385                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 10386                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 10387                                  ;	ds = cs
 10388                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 10389                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 10390                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 10391                                  ;
 10392                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 10393                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
 10394                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10395                                  
 10396                                  diskrd:	
 10397                                  		;mov	ds:rflag, 2	; romread
 10398                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10399 000008C5 C606[2001]02            		mov	byte [rflag], 2 ; romread
 10400                                  
 10401                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10402                                  
 10403                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10404                                  diskio:
 10405 000008CA 89FB                    		mov	bx, di		; es:bx	= transfer address
 10406 000008CC 8C06[3705]              		mov	[xfer_seg], es	; save transfer	segment
 10407 000008D0 E8F8FB                  		call	SetDrive
 10408 000008D3 268A4510                		mov	al, [es:di+10h]	; [es:di+BDS.media]
 10409 000008D7 A2[1F01]                		mov	[medbyt], al
 10410                                  		;jcxz	short ioret
 10411 000008DA E3E8                    		jcxz	ioret
 10412                                  
 10413                                  ; see if the media is formatted or not by checking the flags field in
 10414                                  ; in the bds. if it is unformatted we cannot allow i/o, so we should
 10415                                  ; go to the error exit at label unformatteddrive.
 10416                                  
 10417 000008DC 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 2
 10418                                  		;test	byte ptr es:[di+24h], 2	; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
 10419                                  					; unformatted_media
 10420 000008E1 75DE                    		jnz	short unformatteddrive
 10421 000008E3 890E[2201]              		mov	[seccnt], cx	; save sector count
 10422 000008E7 8926[3501]              		mov	[spsav], sp	; save sp
 10423                                  
 10424                                  ; ensure that we are trying to access valid sectors on the drive
 10425                                  
 10426 000008EB 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 10427 000008ED 31F6                    		xor	si, si
 10428 000008EF 01CA                    		add	dx, cx
 10429 000008F1 83D600                  		adc	si, 0
 10430 000008F4 26837D0E00              		cmp	word [es:di+0Eh], 0 ; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 10431                                  					; > 32 bit sector ?
 10432 000008F9 740D                    		jz	short sanity32
 10433 000008FB 83FE00                  		cmp	si, 0
 10434 000008FE 75BD                    		jnz	short baddrive
 10435 00000900 263B550E                		cmp	dx, [es:di+0Eh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs16]
 10436 00000904 77B7                    		ja	short baddrive
 10437 00000906 EB12                    		jmp	short sanityok
 10438                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10439                                  
 10440                                  sanity32:				
 10441 00000908 0336[2B05]              		add	si, [start_sec_h]
 10442 0000090C 263B751D                		cmp	si, [es:di+1Dh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32+2]
 10443 00000910 7208                    		jb	short sanityok
 10444 00000912 77A9                    		ja	short baddrive
 10445 00000914 263B551B                		cmp	dx, [es:di+1Bh]	; [es:di+BDS.totalsecs32]
 10446 00000918 77A3                    		ja	short baddrive
 10447                                  
 10448                                  sanityok:				
 10449 0000091A 8B16[2B05]              		mov	dx, [start_sec_h]
 10450 0000091E 26034517                		add	ax, [es:di+17h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs]
 10451 00000922 26135519                		adc	dx, [es:di+19h]	; [es:di+BDS.hiddensecs+2]
 10452                                  
 10453                                  ; now dx;ax have the physical first sector.
 10454                                  ; since the following procedures is going to destroy ax, let's
 10455                                  ; save it temporarily to saved_word.
 10456                                  
 10457 00000926 A3[2D05]                		mov	[saved_word], ax ; save the sector number (low)
 10458                                  
 10459                                  ; set up pointer to disk base table in [dpt]. we cannot assume that iosetup
 10460                                  ; will do it because we will skip the set up stuff with hard disks.
 10461                                  
 10462 00000929 06                      		push	es
 10463 0000092A 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10464 0000092E 26C4367800              		les	si, [es:DSKADR]
 10465                                  		;les	si, es:78h	; [es:DSKADR]
 10466                                  					; current disk parm table
 10467 00000933 8936[2D01]              		mov	[dpt], si
 10468 00000937 8C06[2F01]              		mov	[dpt+2], es
 10469 0000093B 07                      		pop	es
 10470 0000093C 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10471                                  					; fnon_removable
 10472 00000941 7510                    		jnz	short skip_setup
 10473 00000943 E8F6FE                  		call	checksingle
 10474                                  
 10475                                  ; check to see if we have previously noted a change line. the routine
 10476                                  ; returns if everything is ok. otherwise, it pops off the stack and returns
 10477                                  ; the proper error code.
 10478                                  
 10479 00000946 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0 ; do we have changeline support?
 10480 0000094B 7403                    		jz	short diskio_nochangeline ; brif not
 10481 0000094D E8AB0E                  		call	checklatchio	; will do a sneaky pop stack return
 10482                                  					; if a disk error occurs
 10483                                  diskio_nochangeline:			
 10484 00000950 E84700                  		call	iosetup		; set up tables	and variables for i/o
 10485                                  
 10486                                  ; now the settle values are correct for the following code
 10487                                  
 10488                                  skip_setup:
 10489                                  
 10490                                  ; 32 bit sector calculation.
 10491                                  ; dx:[saved_word] = starting sector number.
 10492                                  				
 10493 00000953 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx
 10494 00000955 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 10495 00000957 26F77513                		div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 10496                                  					 ; divide by sec per track
 10497 0000095B A3[2905]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
 10498 0000095E A1[2D05]                		mov	ax, [saved_word]
 10499 00000961 26F77513                		div	word [es:di+13h] ; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 10500                                  					; now, [temp_h]:ax = track #, dx = sector
 10501                                  		;inc	dl		; sector number	is 1 based.
 10502                                  		; 18/12/2022
 10503 00000965 42                      		inc	dx
 10504 00000966 8816[3101]              		mov	[cursec], dl	; save current sector
 10505 0000096A 268B4D15                		mov	cx, [es:di+15h]	; es:di+BDS.heads]
 10506                                  					; get number of	heads
 10507 0000096E 50                      		push	ax
 10508 0000096F 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 10509 00000971 A1[2905]                		mov	ax, [temp_h]	; divide tracks	by heads per cylinder
 10510 00000974 F7F1                    		div	cx
 10511 00000976 A3[2905]                		mov	[temp_h], ax
 10512 00000979 58                      		pop	ax
 10513 0000097A F7F1                    		div	cx		; now, [temp_h]:ax = cylinder #, dx = head
 10514 0000097C 833E[2905]00            		cmp	word [temp_h], 0
 10515 00000981 7714                    		ja	short baddrive_brdg
 10516 00000983 3D0004                  		cmp	ax, 1024	; 2^10 currently maxium	for track #.
 10517 00000986 770F                    		ja	short baddrive_brdg
 10518 00000988 8816[3201]              		mov	[curhd], dl	; save current head
 10519 0000098C A3[3301]                		mov	[curtrk], ax	; save current track
 10520                                  
 10521                                  ; we are now set up for the i/o. normally, we consider the dma boundary
 10522                                  ; violations here. not true. we perform the operation as if everything is
 10523                                  ; symmetric; let the int 13 handler worry about the dma violations.
 10524                                  
 10525 0000098F A1[2201]                		mov	ax, [seccnt]
 10526 00000992 E88400                  		call	block		; (cas - call/ret)
 10527                                  		;call	done
 10528                                  		;retn
 10529                                  		; 18/12/2022
 10530 00000995 EB4B                    		jmp	done
 10531                                  
 10532                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10533                                  
 10534                                  baddrive_brdg:				
 10535 00000997 E923FF                  		jmp	baddrive
 10536                                  
 10537                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10538                                  
 10539                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10540                                  ; set the drive-last-accessed flag for diskette only. 
 10541                                  ; we know that the hard disk will not be removed.
 10542                                  ; es:di -> current bds.
 10543                                  ; ds -> Bios_Data
 10544                                  ; ax,cx,si are destroyed.
 10545                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10546                                  
 10547                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10548                                  iosetup:	
 10549 0000099A 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10550 0000099E A2[1E01]                		mov	[tim_drv], al	; save drive letter
 10551                                  
 10552                                  ; determine proper head settle values
 10553                                  
 10554 000009A1 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10555 000009A6 7539                    		jnz	short skip_dpt_setting
 10556 000009A8 A0[2C01]                		mov	al, [eot]	; fetch	up eot before changing ds
 10557 000009AB 1E                      		push	ds
 10558 000009AC C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]	; get pointer to disk base table
 10559 000009B0 884404                  		mov	[si+4],	al
 10560 000009B3 8A440A                  		mov	al, [si+10]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_MOTOR_STRT]
 10561 000009B6 8A6404                  		mov	ah, [si+4]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_EOT]
 10562 000009B9 1F                      		pop	ds
 10563 000009BA A2[2601]                		mov	[motorstartup], al
 10564 000009BD 8826[2B01]              		mov	[save_eot], ah
 10565                                  
 10566                                  ; for 3.5" drives, both external as well as on the k09, we need to set the
 10567                                  ; motor start time to 4. this checking for every i/o is going to affect
 10568                                  ; performance across the board, but is necessary!!
 10569                                  
 10570 000009C1 1E                      		push	ds
 10571 000009C2 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]	; get pointer to disk base table
 10572 000009C6 26807D2202              		cmp	byte [es:di+22h], 2 ; [es:di+BDS.formfactor]
 10573                                  					; ffSmall
 10574 000009CB 7505                    		jnz	short motor_start_ok
 10575 000009CD B004                    		mov	al, 4
 10576 000009CF 86440A                  		xchg	al, [si+10]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_MOTOR_STRT]
 10577                                  motor_start_ok:
 10578                                  
 10579                                  ; ds:si now points to disk parameter table.
 10580                                  ; get current settle and set fast settle
 10581                                  				
 10582                                  		;xor	al, al
 10583                                  		;inc	al		; ibm wants fast settle	to be 1
 10584                                  		; 18/12/2022
 10585 000009D2 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax
 10586 000009D4 40                      		inc	ax
 10587 000009D5 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10588                                  					; get settle and set up	for fast
 10589 000009D8 1F                      		pop	ds
 10590 000009D9 A2[2701]                		mov	[settlecurrent], al
 10591 000009DC B00F                    		mov	al, 15		; NORMSETTLE
 10592                                  					; someone has diddled the settle
 10593 000009DE A2[2801]                		mov	[settleslow], al
 10594                                  skip_dpt_setting:			
 10595 000009E1 C3                      		retn
 10596                                  
 10597                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10598                                  
 10599                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------
 10600                                  ; set time of last access, and reset default values in the dpt.
 10601                                  ;
 10602                                  ;	  note: trashes (at least) si

 11027                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11028                                  
 11029                                  ; this routine is called if an error occurs while formatting or verifying.
 11030                                  ; it resets the drive,and decrements the retry count.
 11031                                  ; on entry - ds:di - points to bds for the drive
 11032                                  ;	     bp    - contains retry count

 11039                                  					; do not decrement retry count.
 11040 00000C11 4D                      		dec	bp		; decrement retry count
 11041 00000C12 C3                      		retn
 11042                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11043                                  
 11044                                  dont_dec_retry_count:			
 11045 00000C13 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 11046 00000C15 C3                      		retn

 11059                                  ; NOTE: GetAccessFlag/SetAccessFlag is unpublished function.
 11060                                  ;
 11061                                  ;      This function is intended to give the user to control the
 11062                                  ;      bds table flags of unformatted_media bit.
 11063                                  ;      GetAccessFlag will show the status -
 11064                                  ;	 a_DiskAccess_Control.dac_access_flag = 0 disk i/o not allowed
 11065                                  ;						1 disk i/o allowed
 11066                                  ;      SetAccessFlag will set/reset the unformatted_media bit in flags -
 11067                                  ;	 a_DiskAccess_Control.dac_access_flag = 0 allow disk i/o
 11068                                  ;						1 disallow disk i/o
 11069                                  ; ==========================================================================

 11134 00000C3B 60                      IOC_DC_Table:	db 60h			; GET_DEVICE_PARAMETERS

 11152                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11153                                  ; Do_Generic_IOCtl: perform generic ioctl request
 11154                                  ;
 11155                                  ;    input: AL contains logical drive
 11156                                  ;
 11157                                  ;	functions are dispatched through a call. On return, carry indicates
 11158                                  ;	error code in al. Note::bES:b& ds undefined on return from
 11159                                  ;	subfunctions.
 11160                                  ;
 11161                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11162                                  
 11163                                  ; 11/03/2019
 11164                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11165                                  do_generic_ioctl:			; 2C7h:0C6Bh = 70h:31DBh
 11166 00000C46 E882F8                  		call	SetDrive	; ES:DI	Points to bds for drive
 11167 00000C49 06                      		push	es
 11168 00000C4A C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX	Points to request header
 11169 00000C4E 26807F0D08              		cmp	byte [es:bx+0Dh], 8 ; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.MAJORFUNCTION]
 11170                                  					; RAWIO
 11171 00000C53 268A470E                		mov	al, [es:bx+0Eh]	; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.MINORFUNCTION]
 11172 00000C57 07                      		pop	es
 11173 00000C58 7525                    		jnz	short IoctlFuncErr
 11174                                  
 11175                                  		; cas note: Could do the above two blocks in reverse order.
 11176                                  		; Would have to preserve al for SetDrive
 11177                                  
 11178                                  		; 10/12/2022
 11179 00000C5A BE[170C]                		mov	si, IoReadJumpTable
 11180                                  		;mov	si, 0C3Ch	; IoReadJumpTable
 11181                                  					; at 2C7h:0C3Ch	= 70h:31ACh
 11182 00000C5D A820                    		test	al, 20h		; GEN_IOCTL_FN_TST ; test of req. function
 11183 00000C5F 7503                    		jnz	short NotGenericWrite ; function is a read.
 11184                                  		; 10/12/2022
 11185 00000C61 BE[2A0C]                		mov	si, IoWriteJumpTable
 11186                                  		;mov	si, 0C4Fh	; IoWriteJumpTable
 11187                                  					; at 2C7h:0C4Fh	= 70h:31BFh
 11188                                  NotGenericWrite:			
 11189 00000C64 24DF                    		and	al, 0DFh	; ~GEN_IOCTL_FN_TST ; get rid of read/write bit
 11190 00000C66 2C40                    		sub	al, 40h		; offset for base function
 11191 00000C68 2E3A04                  		cmp	al, [cs:si]
 11192 00000C6B 7712                    		ja	short IoctlFuncErr
 11193 00000C6D 98                      		cbw
 11194 00000C6E D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
 11195 00000C70 46                      		inc	si
 11196 00000C71 01C6                    		add	si, ax
 11197 00000C73 2EFF14                  		call	near [cs:si]
 11198                                  		;call	word ptr cs:[si]
 11199 00000C76 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 11200                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 11201                                  					; 2C7h:30h = 70h:25A0h
 11202 00000C7B B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; Return this status in	case of	carry
 11203 00000C7D C3                      		retn			; Pass carry flag through to exit code
 11204                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11205                                  
 11206                                  		; Cmd_Error_Proc is called as a procedure and also use
 11207                                  		; as a fall through from above
 11208                                  Cmd_Error_Proc:				; 2C7h:0CA3h = 70h:3213h
 11209 00000C7E 5A                      		pop	dx

 11217                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11218                                  ;**	GetDeviceParameters:
 11219                                  ;
 11220                                  ;	GetDeviceParameters implements the generic ioctl function:
 11221                                  ;	majorcode=RAWIO, minorcode=GetDeviceParameters (60h)
 11222                                  ;
 11223                                  ;	ENTRY	(ES:di) = BDS for drive
 11224                                  ;		PtrSav = long pointer to request header
 11225                                  ;	EXIT	??? BUGBUG
 11226                                  ;	USES	??? BUGBUG
 11227                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11228                                  
 11229                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11230                                  GetDeviceParameters:
 11231                                  		; Copy info from bds to the device parameters packet
 11232                                  
 11233 00000C82 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header
 11234 00000C86 C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; [bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 11235                                  					; (DS:BX) = return buffer
 11236 00000C89 268A4522                		mov	al, [es:di+34]	; [es:di+BDS.formfactor]
 11237 00000C8D 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE]
 11238 00000C90 268B4523                		mov	ax, [es:di+35]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 11239 00000C94 83E003                  		and	ax, 3		; fnon_removable+fchangeline
 11240                                  					; Mask off other bits
 11241 00000C97 894702                  		mov	[bx+2],	ax	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES]
 11242 00000C9A 268B4525                		mov	ax, [es:di+37]	; [es:di+BDS.cylinders]
 11243 00000C9E 894704                  		mov	[bx+4],	ax	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS]
 11244 00000CA1 30C0                    		xor	al, al		; Set media type to default
 11245 00000CA3 884706                  		mov	[bx+6],	al	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_MEDIATYPE]
 11246                                  					
 11247                                  		; copy recommended bpb
 11248 00000CA6 8D7527                  		lea	si, [di+39]	; [di+BDS.rbytespersec]	= [di+BDS.R_BPB]
 11249 00000CA9 F60701                  		test	byte [bx], 1	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_SPECIALFUNCTIONS]
 11250                                  					; BUILD_DEVICE_BPB
 11251 00000CAC 7412                    		jz	short UseBpbPresent
 11252 00000CAE 1E                      		push	ds		; Save request packet segment
 11253 00000CAF 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 11254                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 11255                                  					; 2C7h:30h = 70h:25A0h
 11256                                  					; Point back to Bios_Data
 11257 00000CB4 E885FB                  		call	checksingle
 11258 00000CB7 E83EF9                  		call	GetBp		; Build	the bpb	from scratch
 11259 00000CBA 1F                      		pop	ds		; Restore request packet segment
 11260 00000CBB 720F                    		jb	short GetParmRet
 11261 00000CBD 8D7506                  		lea	si, [di+6]	; [di+BDS.bytespersec] = [di+BSD.DP_BPB]
 11262                                  					; Use this subfield of bds instead
 11263                                  UseBpbPresent:				
 11264 00000CC0 8D7F07                  		lea	di, [bx+7]	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB]
 11265                                  					; This is where	the result goes
 11266 00000CC3 B91900                  		mov	cx, 25		; A_BPB.size - 6
 11267                                  					; For now use 'small' bpb
 11268 00000CC6 1E                      		push	ds		; reverse segments for copy
 11269 00000CC7 06                      		push	es
 11270 00000CC8 1F                      		pop	ds
 11271 00000CC9 07                      		pop	es
 11272 00000CCA F3A4                    		rep movsb
 11273                                  		
 11274                                  		; 12/12/2022
 11275                                  		; cf=0 (test instruction -above- resets cf) 	
 11276                                  		;clc
 11277                                  GetParmRet:				
 11278 00000CCC C3                      		retn

 11440                                  ; FormatTrack:
 11441                                  ; if specialfunction byte is 1,then this is a status call to see if there is
 11442                                  ; rom support for the combination of sec/trk and # of cyln,and if the
 11443                                  ; combination is legal. if specialfunction byte is 0,then format the track.
 11444                                  ;
 11445                                  ; input: ES:di points to bds for drive
 11446                                  ;
 11447                                  ; output:
 11448                                  ;	for status call:
 11449                                  ;	specialfunction byte set to:
 11450                                  ;		0 - rom support + legal combination
 11451                                  ;		1 - no rom support
 11452                                  ;		2 - illegal combination
 11453                                  ;		3 - no media present
 11454                                  ;	carry cleared.
 11455                                  ;
 11456                                  ;	for format track:
 11457                                  ;		carry set if error
 11458                                  ;
 11459                                  ; ==========================================================================
 11460                                  
 11461                                  ; 16/03/2019
 11462                                  
 11463                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11464                                  FormatTrack:
 11465 00000D98 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]
 11466 00000D9C C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; [bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET
 11467 00000D9F F60701                  		test	byte [bx], 1	; [bx+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_SPECIALFUNCTIONS]
 11468                                  					; STATUS_FOR_FORMAT

 11470 00000DA4 1E                      		push	ds
 11471                                  		; 17/10/2022

 11473                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]

 11477 00000DB0 F8                      		clc
 11478 00000DB1 C3                      		retn

 11510                                  					; about	the illegal combination)

 11515 00000DE1 52                      		push	dx

 11517 00000DE5 5A                      		pop	dx
 11518                                  NoSetDasd:

 11520 00000DE9 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx		; Get track from packet
 11521 00000DEB A3[3901]                		mov	[trknum], ax
 11522 00000DEE 880E[3801]              		mov	[hdnum], cl	; Store	head from packet
 11523 00000DF2 88CC                    		mov	ah, cl

 11532                                  FormatRetry:

 11542                                  					; NOTE:	because	of bug in some BIOSes we have to
 11543                                  					;	set ES:BX to 00:00

 11546 00000E1C 891E[3705]              		mov	[xfer_seg], bx

 11554                                  FormatError:

 11609 00000E7D 8B0E[3905]              		mov	cx, [sectorspertrack]
 11610                                  
 11611                                  		; Check specialfunctions to see if DO_FAST_FORMAT has been
 11612                                  		; specified if not we should go to the normal track verification
 11613                                  		; routine. If fast format has been specified we should get the
 11614                                  		; number of tracks to be verified and check it to see if it is
 11615                                  		; > 255. If it is then it is an error and we should go to
 11616                                  		; VerifyTrack_Err. If not multiply the number of tracks by the
 11617                                  		; sectors per track to get the total number of sectors to be
 11618                                  		; verified. This should also be less than equal to 255
 11619                                  		; otherwise we go to same error exit. If everything is okay
 11620                                  		; we initalise cx to the total sectors. use ax as a temporary
 11621                                  		; register.
 11622                                  
 11623                                  					; Special function requested?

 11625 00000E84 7421                    		jz	short NormVerifyTrack

 11628 00000E8A 752C                    		jnz	short VerifyTrack_Err ; #tracks > 255
 11629 00000E8C F6E1                    		mul	cl
 11630 00000E8E 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 11631 00000E90 7526                    		jnz	short VerifyTrack_Err ; #sectors > 255	
 11632 00000E92 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax

 11634 00000E94 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+35], 1
 11635                                  		;test	word [es:di+35], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 11636                                  					; fnon_removable
 11637 00000E99 740C                    		jz	short NormVerifyTrack
 11638                                  					; Multitrack operation = on?
 11639                                  		; 10/12/2022
 11640                                  		; 19/10/2022
 11641 00000E9B F606[2F05]80            		test	byte [multrk_flag], 80h
 11642                                  		;test	word [multrk_flag], 80h ; MULTI_TRK_ON
 11643                                  		;;test	ds:multrk_flag,	80h ; MULTI_TRK_ON
 11644 00000EA0 7405                    		jz	short NormVerifyTrack
 11645 00000EA2 C606[3605]01            		mov	byte [multitrk_format_flag], 1

 11699                                  ReadWriteTrack:	
 11700                                  		; save bds pointer segment so we can use it to access
 11701                                  		; our packet. Notice that this is not the standard register
 11702                                  		; assignment for accessing packets

 11704                                  		; 19/10/2022

 11707 00000ECE 26C45F13                		les	bx, [es:bx+19]	; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]

 11712 00000EE0 268B4705                		mov	ax, [es:bx+5]	; [es:bx+A_TRACKREADWRITEPACKET.TRWP_FIRSTSECTOR]
 11713 00000EE4 268B4F07                		mov	cx, [es:bx+7]	; [es:bx+A_TRACKREADWRITEPACKET.TRWP_SECTORSTOREADWRITE]
 11714 00000EE8 26C45F09                		les	bx, [es:bx+9]	; [es:bx+A_TRACKREADWRITEPACKET.TRWP_TRANSFERADDRESS]
 11715                                  					; Get transfer address
 11716                                  
 11717                                  		; we just trashed our packet address, but we no longer care
 11718
