 12840                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 12841                                  
 12842                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12843                                  ; MSINT13.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 12844                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12845                                  ; 16/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 12846                                  
 12847                                  ;	int 2f function 13h allows the user to change the orig13 int_13 vector
 12848                                  ;	after booting. this allows testing and implementation of custom int_13
 12849                                  ;	handlers, without giving up ms-dos error recovery
 12850                                  ;	entry:	ds:dx	== addr. of new int_13 handler
 12851                                  ;		es:bx	== addr. of new int_13 vector used by warm boot (int19)
 12852                                  ;	exit:	orig13	== address of new int_13 handler
 12853                                  ;		ds:dx	== old orig13 value
 12854                                  ;		es:bx	== old old13  value
 12855                                  ;
 12856                                  ; int 2f handler for external block drivers to communicate with the internal
 12857                                  ; block driver in msdisk. the multiplex number chosen is 8. the handler
 12858                                  ; sets up the pointer to the request packet in [ptrsav] and then jumps to
 12859                                  ; dsk_entry, the entry point for all disk requests.
 12860                                  ;
 12861                                  ; on exit from this driver, we will return to the external driver
 12862                                  ; that issued this int 2f, and can then remove the flags from the stack.
 12863                                  ; this scheme allows us to have a small external device driver, and makes
 12864                                  ; the maintainance of the various drivers (driver and msbio) much easier,
 12865                                  ; since we only need to make changes in one place (most of the time).
 12866                                  ;
 12867                                  ;   ax=800h - check for installed handler - reserved
 12868                                  ;   ax=801h - install the bds into the linked list
 12869                                  ;   ax=802h - dos request
 12870                                  ;   ax=803h - return bds table starting pointer in ds:di
 12871                                  ;	   (ems device driver hooks int 13h to handle 16kb dma overrun
 12872                                  ;	    problem. bds table is going to be used to get head/sector
 12873                                  ;	    informations without calling generic ioctl get device parm call.)
 12874                                  
 12875                                  ;BIOSSEGMENT equ 70h
 12876                                  DOSBIOSSEG equ 0070h ; 17/10/2022	
 12877                                  
 12878                                  ;;BIOSCODE:1302h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 12879                                  
 12880                                  i2f_handler:				; here is 02C7h:1302h =	0070h:3872h
 12881 000012B9 80FC13                  		cmp	ah, 13h
 12882 000012BC 7413                    		jz	short int2f_replace_int13
 12883 000012BE 80FC08                  		cmp	ah, 8
 12884 000012C1 743B                    		jz	short mine
 12885                                  
 12886                                  ; Check for WIN386 startup and return the BIOS instance data
 12887                                  
 12888 000012C3 80FC16                  		cmp	ah, 16h		; MultWin386
 12889 000012C6 7479                    		jz	short win386call
 12890 000012C8 80FC4A                  		cmp	ah, 4Ah		; multMULT
 12891 000012CB 7503                    		jnz	short i2f_handler_iret
 12892 000012CD E9A500                  		jmp	handle_multmult
 12893                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12894                                  
 12895                                  i2f_handler_iret:			
 12896 000012D0 CF                      		iret
 12897                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12898                                  
 12899                                  int2f_replace_int13:

 12901 000012D2 8CD8                    		mov	ax, ds	; then we can use ds: -> Bios_Data
 12902                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h] ; 15/10/2022	
 12903                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 12904                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 12905 000012D4 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
 12906                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12907                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13	; save old value of old13 and
 12908                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13+2	; orig13 so that we can
 12909                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13	; return them to caller
 12910                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13+2
 12911 000012D9 FF36[B400]              		push	word [Orig13]
 12912 000012DD FF36[B600]              		push	word [Orig13+2]
 12913 000012E1 FF36[0601]              		push	word [Old13]
 12914 000012E5 FF36[0801]              		push	word [Old13+2]
 12915                                  
 12916                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13, dx	; orig13 := addr. of new int_13
 12917                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13+2, ax
 12918                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13, bx	; old13 := addr. of new boot_13
 12919                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13+2, es
 12920 000012E9 8916[B400]              		mov	[Orig13], dx
 12921 000012ED A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
 12922 000012F0 891E[0601]              		mov	[Old13], bx
 12923 000012F4 8C06[0801]              		mov	[Old13+2], es
 12924                                  
 12925 000012F8 07                      		pop	es			; es:bx := old old13 vector
 12926 000012F9 5B                      		pop	bx
 12927 000012FA 1F                      		pop	ds			; ds:dx := old orig13 vector
 12928 000012FB 5A                      		pop	dx
 12929 000012FC 58                      		pop	ax

 12992                                  		;lds	di, ds:start_bds

 13000                                  ; WIN386 startup stuff is done here. If starting up we set our WIN386 present
 13001                                  ; flag and return instance data. If exiting, we reset the WIN386 present flag
 13002                                  ; NOTE: We assume that the BIOS int 2fh is at the bottom of the chain.
 13003                                  
 13004                                  win386call:				
 13005 00001341 1E                      		push	ds
 13006 00001342 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13007                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13008                                  					; at 2C7h:30h =	70h:25A0h
 13009 00001347 3C05                    		cmp	al, 5		; Win386_Init
 13010                                  					; is it	win386 initializing?
 13011 00001349 7410                    		jz	short Win386Init
 13012 0000134B 3C06                    		cmp	al, 6		; Win386_Exit
 13013                                  					; is it	win386 exiting?
 13014 0000134D 7523                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not, continue int2f chain
 13015                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13016 0000134F F6C201                  		test	dl, 1
 13017                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it	win386 or win286 dos extender?
 13018 00001352 751E                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 13019                                  		;and	ds:IsWin386, 0	; indicate that	win386 is not present  
 13020 00001354 8026[CE08]00            		and	byte [IsWin386], 0 
 13021 00001359 EB17                    		jmp	short win_iret
 13022                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13023                                  
 13024                                  Win386Init:	
 13025                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13026 0000135B F6C201                  		test	dl, 1			
 13027                                  		;test	dx, 1		; is it win386 or win286 dos extender?
 13028 0000135E 7512                    		jnz	short win_iret	; if not win386, then continue
 13029                                  		;or	ds:IsWin386, 1	; Indicate WIN386 present
 13030 00001360 800E[CE08]01            		or	byte [IsWin386], 1
 13031                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next, bx	; Hook our structure into chain
 13032                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:SI_Next+2, es
 13033 00001365 891E[9C08]              		mov	[SI_Next], bx
 13034 00001369 8C06[9E08]              		mov	[SI_Next+2], es
 13035                                  		;mov	bx, offset Win386_SI ; point ES:BX to Win386_SI
 13036 0000136D BB[9A08]                		mov	bx, Win386_SI	; 19/10/2022
 13037 00001370 1E                      		push	ds
 13038 00001371 07                      		pop	es
 13039                                  win_iret:				
 13040 00001372 1F                      		pop	ds
 13041                                  ii2f_iret:	; 10/12/2022	
 13042 00001373 EB88                    		jmp	short i2f_iret	; return back up the chain
 13043                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------

 13045                                  handle_multmult:			
 13046 00001375 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1
 13047 00001377 7515                    		jnz	short try_2
 13048 00001379 1E                      		push	ds
 13049 0000137A E84700                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 13050                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13051                                  		;xor	bx, bx
 13052                                  		;dec	bx
 13053 0000137D BBFFFF                  		mov	bx, 0FFFFh
 13054 00001380 8EC3                    		mov	es, bx		; seg of HMA
 13055 00001382 89FB                    		mov	bx, di
 13056 00001384 F7D3                    		not	bx
 13057 00001386 09DB                    		or	bx, bx
 13058 00001388 7401                    		jz	short try_1
 13059 0000138A 43                      		inc	bx
 13060                                  try_1:					
 13061 0000138B 1F                      		pop	ds
 13062 0000138C EBE5                    		jmp	short ii2f_iret
 13063                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13064                                  
 13065                                  try_2:					
 13066 0000138E 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; multMULTALLOCHMA
 13067 00001390 7530                    		jnz	short try_3
 13068 00001392 1E                      		push	ds
 13069                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13070                                  		;xor	di, di
 13071                                  		;dec	di
 13072 00001393 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh	; assume not enough space
 13073 00001396 8EC7                    		mov	es, di
 13074 00001398 E82900                  		call	HMAPtr		; get offset of free HMA
 13075 0000139B 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13076 0000139E 7421                    		jz	short InsuffHMA
 13077 000013A0 F7DF                    		neg	di		; free space in HMA
 13078 000013A2 39FB                    		cmp	bx, di
 13079 000013A4 7605                    		jbe	short try_4
 13080                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13081                                  		;sub	di, di
 13082                                  		;dec	di
 13083 000013A6 BFFFFF                  		mov	di, 0FFFFh
 13084 000013A9 EB16                    		jmp	short InsuffHMA
 13085                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13086                                  
 13087                                  try_4:					
 13088                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13089 000013AB 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13090 000013AF 83C30F                  		add	bx, 15
 13091                                  		;and	bx, 0FFF0h
 13092                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13093 000013B2 80E3F0                  		and	bl, 0F0h
 13094                                  		;add	ds:FreeHMAPtr, bx ; update the free pointer	
 13095 000013B5 011E[F508]              		add	[FreeHMAPtr], bx
 13096 000013B9 7506                    		jnz	short InsuffHMA

 13098                                  		;mov	ds:FreeHMAPtr, 0FFFFh
 13099                                  					; no more HMA if we have wrapped
 13100                                  InsuffHMA:				
 13101 000013C1 1F                      		pop	ds
 13102                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13103                                  try_3:

 13105                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13106                                  
 13107                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13108                                  ;try_3:					
 13109                                  		;jmp	ii2f_iret

 13111                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13112                                  
 13113                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13114                                  
 13115                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13116                                  ;
 13117                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13118                                  ;
 13119                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13120                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13121                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13122                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13123                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13124                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13125                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13126                                  ;
 13127                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13128                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13129                                  ;
 13130                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13131                                  
 13132                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13133                                  HMAPtr:
 13134 000013C4 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13135                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13136 000013C9 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13137                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13138 000013CD 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13139 000013D0 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13140 000013D2 803E[FB08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13141                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13142 000013D7 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13143 000013D9 FF1E[F708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13144                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13145 000013DD 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13146                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13147                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13148 000013E1 C3                      		retn
 13149                                  
 13150                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13151                                  
 13152                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13153                                  
 13154                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13155                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13156                                  
 13157                                  move_sector:
 13158                                  
 13159                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13160                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13161                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13162                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13163                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13164                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13165                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13166                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13167                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13168                                  ;
 13169                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13170                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13171                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13172                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13173                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13174                                  
 13175 000013E2 FC                      		cld
 13176 000013E3 51                      		push	cx
 13177 000013E4 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13178 000013E7 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13179 000013EB 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13180 000013ED 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13181 000013F1 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13182 000013F3 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13183 000013F5 59                      		pop	cx
 13184 000013F6 C3                      		retn
 13185                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13186                                  
 13187                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13188 000013F7 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13189 000013F9 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13190 000013FB 59                      		pop	cx
 13191 000013FC C3                      		retn
 13192                                  
 13193                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13194                                  
 13195                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13196                                  
 13197                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13198                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13199                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13200                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13201                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13202                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13203                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13204                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13205                                  ;
 13206                                  ; input conditions:
 13207                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13208                                  ;
 13209                                  ; output:
 13210                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13211                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13212                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13213                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13214                                  
 13215                                  check_wrap:	
 13216 000013FD 50                      		push	ax
 13217 000013FE 53                      		push	bx
 13218 000013FF 06                      		push	es
 13219 00001400 57                      		push	di
 13220 00001401 E86E00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13221 00001404 7260                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13222                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13223 00001406 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13224                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13225 0000140B 7459                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13226 0000140D 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13227 00001411 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13228 00001413 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13229 00001416 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13230 00001418 764C                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13231 0000141A F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13232                                  
 13233                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13234                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13235                                  
 13236 0000141C 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13237 0000141E 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13238                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13239 00001420 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13240 00001421 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13241                                  					; if on	boundary
 13242                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13243                                  not_on_bound:				
 13244 00001423 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13245 00001426 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13246 00001428 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13247 0000142A 40                      		inc	ax
 13248 0000142B 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13249 0000142D 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13250 00001430 263B4515                		cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13251                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13252 00001434 7636                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13253 00001436 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13254 00001437 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13255 00001439 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13256 0000143D F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13257                                  
 13258                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13259                                  
 13260 0000143F 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13261 00001441 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13262 00001443 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13263                                  
 13264                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13265                                  
 13266 00001445 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13267 00001447 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13268 00001449 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13269                                  no_head_bound:				
 13270 0000144A 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13271 0000144C 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13272 0000144D FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13273 0000144F 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13274 00001451 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13275 00001453 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13276 00001456 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13277 00001458 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13278 0000145A D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13279 0000145C 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13280 0000145E 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13281 00001460 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13282 00001462 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13283 00001464 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13284                                  no_wrap:				
 13285 00001466 F8                      		clc
 13286 00001467 5F                      		pop	di
 13287 00001468 07                      		pop	es
 13288 00001469 5B                      		pop	bx
 13289 0000146A 58                      		pop	ax
 13290 0000146B C3                      		retn
 13291                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13292                                  
 13293                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13294 0000146C 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13295 0000146E FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13296 00001470 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13297                                  
 13298                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13299                                  
 13300                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13301                                  
 13302                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13303                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13304                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13305                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13306                                  ;
 13307                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13308                                  
 13309                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13310                                  find_bds:	
 13311 00001472 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13312                                  fbds_1:					
 13313 00001476 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13314 0000147A 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13315 0000147C 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13316                                  					; go to next bds
 13317 0000147F 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13318 00001482 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13319 00001484 F9                      		stc
 13320                                  fdbs_2:					
 13321 00001485 C3                      		retn
 13322                                  
 13323                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13324                                  
 13325                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13326                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13327                                  doint:
 13328                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13329 00001486 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13330                                  					; get physical drive number
 13331                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13332                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13333                                  		
 13334 00001489 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13335 0000148B 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13336 0000148D 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13337                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13338 0000148F 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13339                                  					; get request code
 13340                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13341 00001492 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13342                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13343 00001495 9D                      		popf
 13344                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13345                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13346 00001496 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13347                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13348                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13349 0000149B 9C                      		pushf
 13350                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13351 0000149C 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13352                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13353                                  dointdone:				
 13354 0000149F C3                      		retn
 13355                                  
 13356                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13357                                  
 13358                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13359                                  
 13360                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13361                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13362                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13363                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13364                                  ;
 13365                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13366                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13367                                  ;
 13368                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13369                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13370                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13371                                  
 13372                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13373                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13374                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13375                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13376                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13377                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13378                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13379                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13380                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13381                                  ;end struc
 13382                                  
 13383                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13384                                  
 13385                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13386                                  ;	ah = function
 13387                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13388                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13389                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13390                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13391                                  ;   output conditions:
 13392                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13393                                  
 13394                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13395                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13396                                  ;
 13397                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13398                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13399                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13400                                  
 13401                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13402                                  
 13403                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13404                                  
 13405 000014A0 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13406                                  
 13407                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13408                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13409                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13410                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13411                                  
 13412                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13413                                  
 13414                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13415                                  
 13416                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13417                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13418                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13419                                  
 13420                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13421 000014A4 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13422 000014A9 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13423 000014AB 53                      		push	bx
 13424 000014AC BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13425 000014AF E83804                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13426 000014B2 5B                      		pop	bx
 13427 000014B3 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13428                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13429                                  
 13430                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13431                                  
 13432                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13433                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13434                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 13435                                  
 13436                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13437                                  ec35_special_stuff:			
 13438 000014B5 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 13439 000014B7 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 13440 000014B9 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 13441 000014BA 51                      		push	cx
 13442 000014BB 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13443 000014BD B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13444 000014BF D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13445 000014C1 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13446 000014C5 59                      		pop	cx
 13447 000014C6 58                      		pop	ax
 13448 000014C7 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13449                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13450 000014C9 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13451 000014CA 06                      		push	es
 13452                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13453 000014CB 2EC41E[A014]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13454                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13455                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 13456 000014D0 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 13457 000014D2 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13458 000014D5 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13459                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13460                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13461 000014D9 07                      		pop	es
 13462 000014DA 5B                      		pop	bx
 13463 000014DB EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13464                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13465                                  
 13466                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13467                                  
 13468                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13469                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13470                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13471                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13472                                  
 13473                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13474 000014DD 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13475                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13476 000014E2 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13477 000014E4 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13478                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13479 000014E9 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13480                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13481 000014EB 50                      		push	ax
 13482 000014EC B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13483                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13484                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13485 000014EE 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13486                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13487                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13488 000014F3 58                      		pop	ax
 13489 000014F4 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13490                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13491                                  
 13492                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13493                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13494                                  
 13495                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13496                                  
 13497                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13498                                  
 13499                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13500                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13501                                  
 13502                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13503 000014F6 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13504                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13505                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 13506 000014F7 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13507                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13508                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13509                                  
 13510                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13511                                  
 13512 000014FC A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13513 000014FF 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13514 00001502 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13515                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13516                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13517 00001504 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13518 00001509 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13519                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13520                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13521                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13522 0000150B 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13523                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13524                                  		
 13525 00001510 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13526                                  		
 13527 00001511 803E[3E06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 13528                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13529 00001516 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13530                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13531                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13532 00001518 9D                      		popf
 13533 00001519 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13534                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13535 0000151B 1F                      		pop	ds
 13536 0000151C CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13537                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13538                                  
 13539                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13540                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13541                                  ; a changeline error.
 13542                                  
 13543                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13544 0000151F 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13545                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13546 00001521 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13547 00001524 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13548 00001526 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13549 00001528 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13550 0000152A 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13551 0000152F 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13552                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13553                                  					; never	would
 13554 00001531 53                      		push	bx
 13555 00001532 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13556 00001535 E8B203                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13557 00001538 5B                      		pop	bx
 13558                                  int13b:					
 13559 00001539 F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 13560 0000153A EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13561                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13562                                  
 13563                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13564                                  
 13565                                  goterr13:				
 13566 0000153C 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 13567 0000153F 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 13568                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13569 00001541 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13570 00001544 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13571 00001546 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13572 0000154B 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13573                                  
 13574 0000154D 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13575                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13576                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13577                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13578 00001552 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13579                                  
 13580 00001554 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13581                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13582                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13583 00001556 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13584                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13585                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13586 0000155B A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13587 0000155E 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13588 00001560 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13589 00001562 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13590 00001564 53                      		push	bx
 13591 00001565 51                      		push	cx
 13592 00001566 52                      		push	dx
 13593 00001567 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13594                                  loop_ecc:				
 13595 0000156A B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13596                                  
 13597                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13598                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13599                                  ;
 13600                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13601                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13602                                  ; track.
 13603                                  ;
 13604                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13605                                  ; this request.
 13606                                  ;
 13607                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13608                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13609                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13610                                  ;
 13611 0000156D E88DFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13612                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13613                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13614 00001570 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13615                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13616 00001575 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13617 00001577 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13618 0000157A 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13619 0000157C 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13620 0000157F 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13621                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13622                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 13623                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 13624 00001581 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 13625                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 13626                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 13627                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 13628                                  ok11_op:				
 13629 00001583 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 13630 00001587 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 13631 00001589 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 13632                                  					; add 200h to address
 13633 0000158B FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13634 0000158D FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13635 0000158F EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 13636                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13637                                  
 13638                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 13639                                  
 13640                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 13641 00001591 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 13642                                  ok11_exit:				
 13643 00001592 5A                      		pop	dx
 13644 00001593 59                      		pop	cx
 13645 00001594 5B                      		pop	bx
 13646 00001595 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13647                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13648                                  
 13649                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 13650                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 13651                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 13652                                  
 13653                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 13654 00001597 06                      		push	es
 13655 00001598 53                      		push	bx
 13656 00001599 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13657 0000159C 1E                      		push	ds
 13658 0000159D 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 13659 0000159E B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13660                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 13661                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13662 000015A1 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13663                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13664 000015A6 5B                      		pop	bx
 13665 000015A7 07                      		pop	es
 13666 000015A8 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 13667 000015AA 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 13668 000015AD 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 13669                                  
 13670                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 13671                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 13672                                  
 13673                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 13674 000015AF 56                      		push	si
 13675 000015B0 57                      		push	di
 13676 000015B1 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13677 000015B3 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13678 000015B6 E829FE                  		call	move_sector
 13679 000015B9 5F                      		pop	di
 13680 000015BA 5E                      		pop	si
 13681 000015BB EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 13682                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13683                                  
 13684                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 13685                                  ; operation as best we can.
 13686                                  
 13687                                  gotdmaerr:				
 13688 000015BD A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 13689 000015C0 FB                      		sti
 13690 000015C1 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 13691 000015C4 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13692                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 13693                                  					; functions we don't handle
 13694 000015C6 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 13695 000015C9 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 13696 000015CB 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13697 000015CE 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 13698 000015D0 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 13699                                  
 13700                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 13701                                  
 13702                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 13703                                  
 13704 000015D2 52                      		push	dx
 13705 000015D3 51                      		push	cx
 13706 000015D4 53                      		push	bx
 13707 000015D5 50                      		push	ax
 13708 000015D6 55                      		push	bp
 13709 000015D7 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 13710 000015D9 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 13711 000015DB D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13712 000015DD D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13713 000015DF D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 13714 000015E1 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 13715 000015E3 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 13716 000015E5 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 13717                                  
 13718                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 13719                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 13720                                  
 13721 000015E9 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 13722 000015EB E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 13723                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13724                                  
 13725                                  no_skip_first:				
 13726 000015EE D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 13727 000015F0 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 13728 000015F2 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 13729                                  
 13730                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 13731                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 13732                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 13733                                  ;
 13734                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 13735                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 13736                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 13737                                  ; in error.
 13738                                  
 13739 000015F4 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 13740 000015F6 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 13741                                  
 13742                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 13743                                  
 13744 000015F8 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13745                                  					; set up head number
 13746 000015FB E888FE                  		call	doint
 13747 000015FE E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 13748                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13749                                  
 13750                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 13751 00001601 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 13752 00001603 F9                      		stc
 13753 00001604 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 13754                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 13755                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13756                                  
 13757                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 13758                                  
 13759                                  intverify:				
 13760 00001607 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 13761 00001608 53                      		push	bx
 13762 00001609 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 13763 0000160A 07                      		pop	es
 13764                                  dosimple:				
 13765 0000160B BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13766                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 13767                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 13768                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13769 0000160E 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13770                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13771 00001613 5B                      		pop	bx
 13772 00001614 07                      		pop	es
 13773 00001615 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13774                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13775                                  
 13776                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 13777                                  
 13778                                  intformat:				
 13779 00001618 06                      		push	es
 13780 00001619 53                      		push	bx
 13781 0000161A 56                      		push	si
 13782 0000161B 57                      		push	di
 13783 0000161C 1E                      		push	ds
 13784                                  
 13785                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 13786                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 13787                                  
 13788 0000161D 06                      		push	es
 13789 0000161E 1E                      		push	ds
 13790 0000161F 07                      		pop	es
 13791 00001620 1F                      		pop	ds
 13792 00001621 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 13793 00001623 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 13794 00001626 E8B9FD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 13795 00001629 1F                      		pop	ds
 13796 0000162A 5F                      		pop	di
 13797 0000162B 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 13798 0000162C EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 13799                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13800                                  
 13801                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 13802                                  ; the first block.
 13803                                  ;
 13804                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 13805                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 13806                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 13807                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 13808                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 13809                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 13810                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 13811                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 13812                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 13813                                  
 13814                                  doblock:
 13815                                  
 13816                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 13817                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 13818                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 13819                                  				
 13820 0000162E 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13821                                  					; get head #, drive #
 13822 00001631 51                      		push	cx
 13823 00001632 06                      		push	es
 13824 00001633 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13825                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 13826 00001634 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 13827 00001637 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13828                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13829 0000163B 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13830                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13831 00001640 5F                      		pop	di
 13832 00001641 07                      		pop	es
 13833 00001642 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 13834 00001644 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 13835 00001646 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 13836 00001648 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 13837                                  doblockflop:				
 13838 0000164A 59                      		pop	cx
 13839                                  doblockcontinue:			
 13840 0000164B 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 13841 0000164D 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 13842 0000164F 50                      		push	ax
 13843 00001650 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 13844 00001652 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 13845                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13846                                  
 13847                                  doblocklast:				
 13848 00001654 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 13849 00001656 50                      		push	ax
 13850                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 13851 00001657 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 13852 0000165A 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 13853 0000165C 58                      		pop	ax
 13854 0000165D 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 13855                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 13856 00001660 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 13857 00001662 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 13858 00001664 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 13859 00001666 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 13860 00001668 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 13861                                  					; then we are done already.
 13862 0000166A 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 13863                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 13864 0000166C E88EFD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 13865 0000166F EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 13866                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13867                                  
 13868                                  bufferx:				
 13869 00001671 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 13870                                  					; set up head number
 13871                                  buffer:					
 13872 00001674 53                      		push	bx
 13873 00001675 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13874 00001678 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 13875 0000167B 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 13876                                  					
 13877                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 13878                                  
 13879 0000167D 06                      		push	es
 13880 0000167E 1E                      		push	ds
 13881 0000167F 56                      		push	si
 13882 00001680 57                      		push	di
 13883 00001681 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 13884 00001682 06                      		push	es
 13885 00001683 1F                      		pop	ds
 13886 00001684 07                      		pop	es
 13887 00001685 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 13888 00001688 57                      		push	di		; save it
 13889 00001689 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 13890 0000168B E854FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 13891 0000168E 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 13892                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 13893 0000168F 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 13894 00001690 5E                      		pop	si
 13895 00001691 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 13896                                  
 13897                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 13898                                  
 13899 00001692 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13900                                  					; get drive number
 13901 00001694 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 13902 00001697 E863FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 13903                                  					;
 13904                                  					; ah is	function
 13905                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 13906                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 13907                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 13908                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 13909                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 13910 0000169A E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 13911 0000169D 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 13912 0000169E 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 13913 000016A0 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 13914                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13915                                  
 13916                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 13917                                  
 13918                                  doread:					
 13919 000016A2 06                      		push	es
 13920 000016A3 53                      		push	bx
 13921 000016A4 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 13922 000016A5 07                      		pop	es
 13923 000016A6 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13924 000016A9 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 13925 000016AB 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13926                                  					; get drive number
 13927 000016AE E84CFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 13928                                  					; ah = function
 13929                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 13930                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 13931                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 13932 000016B1 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 13933 000016B4 5B                      		pop	bx
 13934 000016B5 07                      		pop	es
 13935 000016B6 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 13936 000016B8 56                      		push	si
 13937 000016B9 57                      		push	di
 13938 000016BA 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13939 000016BC BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13940 000016BF E820FD                  		call	move_sector
 13941 000016C2 5F                      		pop	di
 13942 000016C3 5E                      		pop	si
 13943                                  
 13944                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 13945                                  
 13946                                  dotail:					
 13947 000016C4 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 13948 000016C5 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 13949 000016C8 41                      		inc	cx
 13950 000016C9 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 13951 000016CC F8                      		clc
 13952 000016CD FEC8                    		dec	al
 13953 000016CF 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 13954                                  
 13955                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 13956                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 13957                                  
 13958 000016D1 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13959 000016D4 E826FD                  		call	check_wrap
 13960 000016D7 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 13961                                  
 13962                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 13963                                  
 13964                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 13965                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 13966                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 13967                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 13968                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 13969                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 13970                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 13971                                  
 13972                                  bad13:					
 13973 000016DA 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 13974 000016DC 5D                      		pop	bp
 13975 000016DD 5B                      		pop	bx
 13976 000016DE 5B                      		pop	bx
 13977 000016DF 59                      		pop	cx
 13978 000016E0 5A                      		pop	dx
 13979 000016E1 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 13980 000016E3 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 13981                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13982                                  
 13983                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 13984 000016E6 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 13985                                  
 13986                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13987                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13988                                  		;db 	0
 13989                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13990                                  
 13991                                  ;Bios_Code ends
 13992                                  
 13993                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
