 18710                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 18711                                  ;
 18712                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 18713                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 18714                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 18715                                  ;
 18716                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 18717                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 18718                                  ; 
 18719                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18720                                  
 18721                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18722                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:092Ah)
 18723                                  TryToMovDOSHi:

 18733                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18734                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18735                                  	; ds = cs

 18738                                  ;	..

 18752                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18753                                  ;
 18754                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 18755                                  ;
 18756                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 18757                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 18758                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 18759                                  ;
 18760                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed
 18761                                  ;
 18762                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18763                                  
 18764                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 18765                                  MovDOSHi:
 18766                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18767                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18768                                  	; ds = cs
 18769 000008F3 E8D800                  	call	AllocHMA
 18770 000008F6 7213                    	jc	short mdhx			; did we get HMA?
 18771 000008F8 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh			; yes, HMA seg = 0ffffh
 18772 000008FB 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 18773                                  
 18774                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 18775                                  	; actually move the BIOS and DOS
 18776                                  
 18777                                  	; NOTE: Retro DOS v4.0 does not move BIOS (IO.SYS) to HMA
 18778                                  	; 24/03/2019
 18779                                  	
 18780                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18781 000008FD E83400                  	call	MovBIOS				; First move BIOS into HMA
 18782                                  
 18783                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after BIOS
 18784                                  	
 18785                                  	; 14/05/2019
 18786                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 18787                                  	;xor	di,di
 18788                                  	
 18789                                  	; 23/10/2022
 18790                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 18791                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18792                                  	; ds = cs
 18793 00000900 8B0E[8102]              	mov	cx,[hi_doscod_size]		; when it is in HMA
 18794 00000904 E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 18795                                  
 18796                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 18797                                  ;else
 18798                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack
 18799                                  ;
 18800                                  ;	mov	di,0E0h				; room for 5 bytes at ffff:d0
 18801                                  ;
 18802                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 18803                                  
 18804 00000907 E86202                  	call	SaveFreeHMAPtr			; Save the Free HMA ptr
 18805 0000090A F8                      	clc
 18806                                  mdhx:
 18807 0000090B C3                      	retn

 18862                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 18863                                  ;
 18864                                  ; procedure : MovDOS
 18865                                  ;
 18866                                  ;		Moves DOS code into requested area
 18867                                  ;
 18868                                  ;	In : ES:DI - pointer to memory where DOS is to be moved
 18869                                  ;	     CX    - size of DOS code to be moved
 18870                                  ;
 18871                                  ;	Out : ES:DI - pointer to memory immediately after DOS
 18872                                  ;

 18874                                  
 18875                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18876                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)

 18938                                  ;
 18939                                  ;		Moves BIOS code into requested segment
 18940                                  ;

 18942                                  ;		  ( it moves always into offset BCode_Start)
 18943                                  ;
 18944                                  ;	Out : ES:DI - pointer to memory immediately after BIOS
 18945                                  ;

 18953                                  	; 11/12/2022
 18954 00000934 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs

 19108 0000096D B448                    	mov	ah,48h				; request DOS
 19109 0000096F CD21                    	int	21h
 19110 00000971 7250                    	jc	short FatalErr			; IF ERR WE ARE HOSED

 19114                                  						;  BIOS code

 19126                                  
 19127                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19128                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19129                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19130                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19131                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19132                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19133                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19134                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19135                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19136                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19137                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19138                                  ;
 19139                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19140                                  
 19141                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19142                                  update_arena:
 19143 00000987 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19144 00000988 57                      	push	di
 19145 00000989 51                      	push	cx
 19146 0000098A 52                      	push	dx
 19147                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19148                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19149                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19150                                  	; ds = cs 
 19151 0000098B C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19152 0000098F 4F                      	dec	di
 19153 00000990 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19154                                  						;  before sysvar
 19155 00000991 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19156                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19157 00000993 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19158 00000998 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19159 0000099A 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19160                                  
 19161                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19162 0000099C 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19163 000009A1 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19164 000009A3 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19165 000009A5 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19166 000009A7 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19167                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19168 000009A9 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19169                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19170 000009AD C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 19171 000009B3 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 19172                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 19173 000009B5 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 19174 000009B9 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 19175                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19176                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 19177 000009BB 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 19178 000009BE 5A                      	pop	dx
 19179 000009BF 59                      	pop	cx
 19180 000009C0 5F                      	pop	di
 19181 000009C1 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19182 000009C2 C3                      	retn
 19183                                  ;
 19184                                  ; M012 : END
 19185                                  ;
 19186                                  FatalErr:

 19189 000009C5 BA[8D08]                	mov	dx,FEmsg
 19190 000009C8 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 19191 000009CA CD21                    	int	21h 		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 19192                                  				; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 19193                                          ;jmp	stall
 19194                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19195 000009CC FA                      	cli
 19196 000009CD F4                      	hlt

 19202                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19203                                  ;
 19204                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19205                                  ;
 19206                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19207                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19208                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19209                                  ;
 19210                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 19211                                  ;
 19212                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19213                                  
 19214                                  AllocHMA:
 19215                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 19216                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 19217                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 19218                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19219                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 19220                                  
 19221                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 19222                                  ;
 19223                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 19224                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 19225                                  ;	push	ax
 19226                                  ;	popf
 19227                                  ;	pushf
 19228                                  ;	pop	ax
 19229                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)
 19230                                  ;	and	ax,0F000h
 19231                                  ;	cmp	ax,0F000h	; 8088/8086?
 19232                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 19233                                  
 19234                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19235                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 19236                                  
 19237 000009CE 1E                      	push	ds
 19238                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data
 19239                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT
 19240                                  	; 21/10/2022
 19241 000009CF B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 19242 000009D2 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19243                                  
 19244 000009D4 E84A00                  	call	IsXMSLoaded
 19245 000009D7 7545                    	jnz	short grabhma_error
 19246                                  
 19247 000009D9 B81043                  	mov	ax,4310h
 19248 000009DC CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; get the vector into es:bx
 19249                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 19250                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 19251                                  
 19252 000009DE 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 19253                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx
 19254 000009E2 8C06[1000]              	mov	[xms+2],es
 19255                                  	;mov	[10h],es
 19256                                  
 19257 000009E6 B401                    	mov	ah,1		; request HMA
 19258 000009E8 BAFFFF                  	mov	dx,0FFFFh
 19259                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19260 000009EB FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19261 000009EF 48                      	dec	ax
 19262 000009F0 7409                    	jz	short allocHMA_1 ; error if not able to allocate HMA
 19263                                  
 19264                                  ;------ Himem may be lying because it has allocated mem for int 15
 19265                                  
 19266 000009F2 B488                    	mov	ah,88h
 19267 000009F4 CD15                    	int	15h
 19268                                  		; Get Extended Memory Size
 19269                                  		; Return: CF clear on success
 19270                                  		; AX = size of memory above 1M in K
 19271 000009F6 83F840                  	cmp	ax,64		; less than 64 K of hma ?
 19272                                  	;jb	short grabhma_error
 19273                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19274 000009F9 7224                    	jb	short grabhma_err ; cf=1
 19275                                  allocHMA_1:
 19276 000009FB B405                    	mov	ah,5		; localenableA20
 19277                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh
 19278 000009FD FF1E[0E00]              	call	far [xms]
 19279 00000A01 48                      	dec	ax
 19280 00000A02 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 19281                                  
 19282 00000A04 E88901                  	call	IsVDiskInstalled
 19283 00000A07 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA
 19284                                  
 19285 00000A09 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh
 19286 00000A0C 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19287 00000A0E 26C70610003412          	mov	word [es:10h],1234h ; see if we can really read/write there
 19288 00000A15 26813E10003412          	cmp	word [es:10h],1234h
 19289                                  	;jne	short grabhma_error ; don't try to load there if XMS lied
 19290                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19291 00000A1C 7401                    	je	short allocHMA_ok	
 19292                                  
 19293                                  ; 11/12/2022
 19294                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 19295                                  ;	; cf=0
 19296                                  ;	;clc
 19297                                  ;	pop	ds
 19298                                  ;	retn
 19299                                  
 19300                                  grabhma_error:
 19301 00000A1E F9                      	stc
 19302                                  	; 11/12/022
 19303                                  grabhma_err:	; cf=1
 19304                                  allocHMA_ok:	; cf=0
 19305 00000A1F 1F                      	pop	ds
 19306 00000A20 C3                      	retn
 19307                                  
 19308                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19309                                  ;
 19310                                  ; procedure : IsXMSLoaded
 19311                                  ;
 19312                                  ;             Checks whether a XMS driver is loaded
 19313                                  ;
 19314                                  ; Returns : Z flag set if XMS driver loaded
 19315                                  ;           Z flag reset if no XMS drivers are present
 19316                                  ;
 19317                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19318                                  
 19319                                  IsXMSLoaded:
 19320 00000A21 B80043                  	mov	ax,4300h
 19321 00000A24 CD2F                    	int	2Fh		; - Multiplex - XMS - INSTALLATION CHECK
 19322                                  				; Return: AL = 80h XMS driver installed
 19323                                  				; AL <> 80h no driver
 19324 00000A26 3C80                    	cmp	al,80h		; XMS installed?
 19325 00000A28 C3                      	retn

 19372                                  
 19373                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19374                                  ;
 19375                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19376                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19377                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19378                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19379                                  ;
 19380                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19381                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19382                                  ;
 19383                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19384                                  
 19385                                  StartVDHead:
 19386                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19387                                  
 19388 00000A46 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19389 00000A4A 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19390 00000A4C 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19391 00000A4E 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19392 00000A50 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19393                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19394 00000A51 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19395                                  VDiskSig1:
 19396 00000A58 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19397                                  
 19398                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19399                                  
 19400 00000A5D 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19401                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19402 00000A63 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19403 00000A72 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19404 00000A74 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)

 19437                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19438                                  ;
 19439                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19440                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19441                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0

 19444                                  ;

 19446                                  ;
 19447                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19448                                  ;
 19449                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------

 19571                                  
 19572                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19573                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19574                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19575                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19576                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19577                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19578                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19579                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19580                                  ;								      ;I070
 19581                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19582                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 19583                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 19584                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 19585                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 19586                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 19587                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 19588                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 19589                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 19590                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 19591                                  ;								      ;I070
 19592                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 19593                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19594

 19633                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 19634                                  ;
 19635                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 19636                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 19637                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 19638                                  ;		the offset.
 19639                                  ;

 19642                                  ;

 19648 00000B71 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx
 19649 00000B73 83C70F                  	add	di,15			; para round
 19650 00000B76 83E7F0                  	and	di,0FFF0h
 19651 00000B79 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 19652 00000B7B D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 19653 00000B7D 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 19654 00000B7F 1E                      	push	ds
 19655                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 0070h
 19656                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 0070h
 19657                                  	; 21/10/2022

 19659 00000B83 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19660 00000B85 893E[F508]              	mov	[FreeHMAPtr],di	   ; (ds:8F7h for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 19661 00000B89 C606[0D00]FF            	mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 19662 00000B8E 1F                      	pop	ds
 19663 00000B8F C3                      	retn

 20591                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 20592                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 20593                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 20594                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 20595                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 20596                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 20597                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 20598                                  ;
 20599                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 20600                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 20601                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 20602                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 20603                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 20604                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 20605                                  ;
 20606                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 20607                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 20608                                  ;
 20609                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 20610                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 20611                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 20612                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 20613                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 20614                                  ;
 20615                                  ;	for round-up machine
 20616                                  ;
 20617                                  ;			  none.
 20618                                  
 20619                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 20620                                  ;
 20621                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 20622                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 20623                                  
 20624                                  	; 24/10/2022
 20625

 20828                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20829                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 20830                                  ;
 20831                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 20832                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 20833                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 20834                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 20835                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 20836                                  ; program).
 20837                                  
 20838                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 20839                                  
 20840                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 20841                                  
 20842 00001041 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 20843                                  
 20844                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 20845                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 20846                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 20847                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 20848                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 20849                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 20850                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 20851                                  ; carridge return.
 20852                                  
 20853                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 20854                                  ;character after =.
 20855

 20857 00001043 1E                      	push	ds
 20858 00001044 07                      	pop	es
 20859 00001045 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 20860 00001046 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 20861                                  
 20862 00001048 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 20863 0000104A FC                      	cld
 20864 0000104B 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 20865 00001051 BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 20866                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 20867 00001054 AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 20868 00001055 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 20869 00001057 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 20870 00001059 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 20871                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 20872 0000105B AC                      	lodsb
 20873 0000105C 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 20874 0000105F 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 20875 00001061 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 20876 00001063 FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 20877 00001065 47                      	inc	di
 20878 00001066 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 20879                                  done_installparm:
 20880 00001068 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 20881 0000106D 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 20882 00001070 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 20883 00001072 2EC606[6D03]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 20884                                  					; starts with cr.
 20885                                  install_seg_set:
 20886 00001078 2EC70600000000          	mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 20887 0000107F 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.

 20975                                  
 20976                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 20977                                  ;
 20978                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 20979                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 20980                                  ;
 20981                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 20982                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 20983                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 20984                                  
 20985                                  ParaRound:
 20986 000010C1 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 20987 000010C4 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 20988 000010C6 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20989 000010C8 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20990 000010CA D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 20991 000010CC C3                      	retn

 20993                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20994                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 20995                                  ;
 20996                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 20997                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 20998                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 20999                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21000                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21001                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21002                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21003                                  ;
 21004                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21005                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21006                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21007                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21008                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21009                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21010                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 21011                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21012                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21013                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21014                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21015                                  ;
 21016                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21017                                  
 21018                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21019                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21020                                  sysinit_base:				
 21021 000010CD 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21022 000010D2 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21023 000010D7 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21024 000010D9 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21025 000010DE 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21026 000010E3 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21027 000010E4 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21028 000010E5 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21029                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21030                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21031 000010E7 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21032 000010EA 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21033 000010EF 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21034                                  
 21035                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21036                                  
 21037 000010F1 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21038 000010F3 0E                      	push	cs
 21039 000010F4 1F                      	pop	ds
 21040 000010F5 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21041 000010F8 CD21                    	int	21h
 21042                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21043                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21044                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21045                                  _stall: 
 21046                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21047 000010FA F4                      	hlt 
 21048                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21049                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21050 000010FB EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21051                                  
 21052                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21053 000010FD 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21054                                  
 21055                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21056                                  
 21057                                  sum_up:
 21058                                  
 21059                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21060                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21061                                  ;
 21062                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21063                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21064                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21065                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21066                                  ;
 21067                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21068                                  
 21069 00001102 1E                      	push	ds
 21070                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21071                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21072 00001103 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21073 00001107 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21074 00001109 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21075 0000110B 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21076 0000110D 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21077                                  					;whole test better fail.
 21078 00001112 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21079 00001114 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21080                                  sum1:
 21081 00001116 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21082 00001118 46                      	inc	si
 21083 00001119 46                      	inc	si
 21084 0000111A E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21085                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21086                                  sum_sys_code:
 21087                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21088 0000111C BE1C11                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21089                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21090                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21091                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21092                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21093                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21094                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 21095                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 21096 0000111F B9[6039]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21097 00001122 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21098 00001124 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21099                                  sum2:
 21100 00001126 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21101 00001129 46                      	inc	si
 21102 0000112A 46                      	inc	si
 21103 0000112B E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 21104 0000112D 1F                      	pop	ds
 21105 0000112E C3                      	retn
 21106                                  
 21107                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21108                                  
 21109                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 21110                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:
 21111 0000112F 0000                    	dw	0

 21128                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21129                                  ; Set_Buffer
 21130                                  ;
 21131                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 21132                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 21133                                  ;
 21134                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 21135                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 21136                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 21137                                  ;
 21138                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 21139                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 21140                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21141                                  
 21142                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21143                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 21144                                  
 21145                                  set_buffer:
 21146 0000114E 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 21147 00001150 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 21148 00001153 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 21149 00001155 B201                    	mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 21150                                  set_buff_1:
 21151                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21152                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 21153 00001157 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 21154                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 21155 00001159 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 21156                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 21157 0000115C C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 21158                                  
 21159 00001161 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 21160 00001163 2E8B0E[9702]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 21161 00001168 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 21162                                  
 21163                                  ;	for each buffer
 21164                                  
 21165                                  nxt_buff:
 21166 00001169 E86300                  	call	set_buffer_info 		; set buf_link,buf_id...
 21167 0000116C 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 21168 0000116E E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 21169                                  
 21170 00001170 2E2B3E[9B02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 21171                                  
 21172 00001175 59                      	pop	cx				; get first buffer
 21173                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 21174 00001176 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx
 21175 00001179 87CF                    	xchg	cx,di
 21176                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_prev],cx	; first->prev = last
 21177                                  	; 25/10/2022
 21178 0000117B 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 21179                                  
 21180 0000117F 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMa ?

 21201                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21202                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21203                                  ;
 21204                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem

 21266                                  ; ======================================================================
 21267                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21268                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21269                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21270                                  
 21271                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21272                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21273                                  ;
 21274                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21275                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21276                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21277                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21278                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21279                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21280                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21281                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21282                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21283                                  ;
 21284                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21285                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21286                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21287                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21288                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21289                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21290                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21291                                  ;	conditions:
 21292                                  ;
 21293                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21294                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21295                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21296                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21297                                  ;
 21298                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21299                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21300                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21301                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21302                                  ;
 21303                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21304                                  ;
 21305                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21306                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21307                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21308                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21309                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21310                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21311                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21312                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21313                                  ;
 21314                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21315                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21316                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21317                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21318                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21319                                  ;
 21320                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21321                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21322                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21323                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21324                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21325                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21326                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21327                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21328                                  ;
 21329                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21330                                  
 21331                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21332                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21333                                  
 21334                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21335                                  stackinit:
 21336 000011F7 50                      	push	ax
 21337 000011F8 1E                      	push	ds
 21338 000011F9 06                      	push	es
 21339 000011FA 53                      	push	bx
 21340 000011FB 51                      	push	cx
 21341 000011FC 52                      	push	dx
 21342 000011FD 57                      	push	di
 21343 000011FE 56                      	push	si
 21344 000011FF 55                      	push	bp
 21345                                  
 21346                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21347                                  
 21348                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21349                                  	; ds = cs
 21350 00001200 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]

 21354                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs

 22166                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22167                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22168                                  
 22169                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22170                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22171                                  
 22172                                  new_init_loop:
 22173                                  
 22174                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22175                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22176                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22177                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22178                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22179                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22180                                  
 22181 000013EC 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22182 000013EF 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22183 000013F1 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22184 000013F5 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22185                                  
 22186 000013F8 1E                      	push	ds
 22187                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22188                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22189                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22190 000013F9 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22191 000013FC 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22192 000013FE 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22193 00001401 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22194 00001403 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22195 00001407 894502                  	mov	word [di+2],ax
 22196 0000140A 1F                      	pop	ds
 22197                                  
 22198 0000140B 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22199 0000140E 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22200 00001412 C3                      	retn
 22201                                  
 22202                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22203                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22204                                  
 22205                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22206                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22207                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22208                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22209                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22210                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22211                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22212                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22213                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22214                                  
 22215                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22216                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22217                                  
 22218                                  setdevmark:
 22219                                  
 22220 00001413 06                      	push	es
 22221 00001414 51                      	push	cx
 22222                                  
 22223 00001415 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22224 0000141A 2E890E[3414]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22225 0000141F 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22226                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22227                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22228 00001421 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22229 00001425 41                      	inc	cx
 22230                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22231 00001426 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22232                                  
 22233 0000142B 59                      	pop	cx
 22234 0000142C 07                      	pop	es
 22235 0000142D 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22236 00001432 C3                      	retn
 22237

 22432 00000001 ????                     .Off:	 resw 1				;AN000; offset address of the table

 22435                                  
 22436                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22437                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 22438                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 22439                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 22440                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22441                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 22442                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 22443                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 22444                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22445                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 22446                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22447                                  
 22448                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 22449                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 22450 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 22451 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 22452 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 22453                                  endstruc
 22454                                  
 22455                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 22456                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 22457                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 22458                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 22459                                  
 22460                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22461                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 22462                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 22463                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 22464                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 22465                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 22466                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 22467                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 22468                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 22469                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 22470                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 22471                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22472                                  
 22473                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 22474                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22475 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22476 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22477 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22478                                  endstruc
 22479                                  
 22480                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22481                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22482                                  ;
 22483                                  ;
 22484                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22485                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22486                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22487                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22488                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22489                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22490                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22491                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22492                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22493                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22494                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22495                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22496                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22497                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22498                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22499                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22500                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22501                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22502                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22503                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22504                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22505                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22506                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22507                                  ;	   :
 22508                                  ;
 22509                                  ;Note:
 22510                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22511                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22512                                  ;
 22513                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22514                                  ;
 22515                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22516                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22517                                  ;
 22518                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22519                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22520                                  ;
 22521                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22522                                  ;
 22523                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22524                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22525                                  ;
 22526                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22527                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22528                                  ;
 22529                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22530                                  ;
 22531                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22532                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22533                                  ;
 22534                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22535                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22536                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22537                                  ;
 22538                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22539                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22540                                  ;
 22541                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22542                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22543                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22544                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22545                                  
 22546                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22547                                  
 22548                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22549                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22550                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 22551                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 22552                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 22553                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 22554                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 22555                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 22556                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 22557                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 22558                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 22559                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 22560                                  
 22561                                  ;**** Function flags
 22562                                  
 22563                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 22564                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 22565                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 22566                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 22567                                  
 22568                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 22569                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 22570 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 22571 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 22572 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 22573 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 22574 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 22575 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 22576                                  endstruc
 22577                                  
 22578                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22579                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 22580                                  ;
 22581                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 22582                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 22583                                  ;	     +-
 22584                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 22585                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 22586                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 22587                                  ;	     |	:
 22588                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22589                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 22590                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 22591                                  ;	     |	:
 22592                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 22593                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 22594                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 22595                                  ;	     +-	:
 22596                                  ;
 22597                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 22598                                  ;
 22599                                  ;Note:
 22600                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 22601                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 22602                                  ;
 22603                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22604                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22605                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22606                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22607                                  
 22608                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 22609                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 22610                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 22611                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 22612                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 22613                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 22614                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 22615                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 22616                                  
 22617                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 22618 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 22619 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 22620 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 22621 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 22622 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 22623                                  endstruc
 22624                                  
 22625                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22626                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 22627                                  ;
 22628                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 22629                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 22630                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 22631                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 22632                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 22633                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 22634                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 22635                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 22636                                  ;
 22637                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 22638                                  ;
 22639                                  ;            +-
 22640                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 22641                                  ;	    | or
 22642                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 22643                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 22644                                  ;	    | or
 22645                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 22646                                  ;	    | or
 22647                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 22648                                  ;	    | or
 22649                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 22650                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 22651                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 22652                                  ;	    | or
 22653                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 22654                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 22655                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 22656                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 22657                                  ;	    +-
 22658                                  ;
 22659                                  ;
 22660                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 22661                                  ;      list.
 22662                                  ;
 22663                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 22664                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 22665                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 22666                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22667                                  
 22668                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 22669                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 22670 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 22671 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 22672 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 22673 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 22674                                  endstruc
 22675                                  
 22676                                  ;--------------------------------
 22677                                  ;**** values for the type field in the result block
 22678                                  
 22679                                  _$P_EOL		   equ	0		;AN000; End of line
 22680                                  _$P_Number	   equ	1		;AN000; Number
 22681                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 22682                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 22683                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 22684                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 22685                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 22686                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 22687                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 22688                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String
 22689                                  
 22690                                  _$P_No_Tag	   equ	0FFh		;AN000; No ITEM_TAG found
 22691                                  
 22692                                  ;**** Return code
 22693                                  ;
 22694                                  ; following return code will be returned in the AX register.
 22695                                  
 22696                                  _$P_No_Error	   equ	0		;AN000; No error
 22697                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
