 22789                                  ;***********************************************************************
 22790                                  ; SysParse;
 22791                                  ;
 22792                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 22793                                  ;
 22794                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 22795                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 22796                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 22797                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 22798                                  ;
 22799                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 22800                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 22801                                  ;		 is in DS.
 22802                                  ;
 22803                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 22804                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 22805                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 22806                                  ;
 22807                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 22808                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 22809                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 22810                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 22811                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 22812                                  ;
 22813                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 22814                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 22815                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 22816                                  ;
 22817                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 22818                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 22819                                  ;
 22820                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 22821                                  ;
 22822                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 22823                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 22824                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 22825                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 22826                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 22827                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 22828                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 22829                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 22830                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 22831                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 22832                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 22833                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 22834                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 22835                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 22836                                  ;	     (tm08)
 22837                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 22838                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 22839                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 22840                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 22841                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 22842                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 22843                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 22844                                  ;					  (tm12)
 22845                                  ;  7/10/87 : Invalid switch/keyword does not work correctly
 22846                                  ;					  (tm13)
 22847                                  ;  7/10/87 : Drive_only breaks 3 bytes after the result buffer
 22848                                  ;					  (tm14)
 22849                                  ;  7/12/87 : Too_Many_Operands sets DX=0 as the PARSE result
 22850                                  ;					  (tm15)
 22851                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 22852                                  
 22853                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 22854                                  
 22855                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 22856                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 22857                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 22858                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 22859                                  
 22860                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 22861                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 22862                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 22863                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 22864                                  ;
 22865                                  
 22866                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 22867                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 22868                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 22869                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 22870                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 22871                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 22872                                  
 22873                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 22874                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 22875                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 22876                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 22877                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 22878                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 22879                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 22880                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 22881                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 22882                                  
 22883                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 22884                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 22885                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 22886                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 22887                                  ;	     segment.
 22888

 22890                                  ;	     in _$P_set_cdi PROC, it assumes CS points to psdata. Change Push CS
 22891                                  ;	     into PUSH cs.  In _$P_Get_DecNum PROC, fix AN020
 22892                                  ;	     forced both TIME and DATE to use the delims, "-","/",".".
 22893                                  ;	     Created FLag, in _$P_time_Format PROC, to request the delim in
 22894                                  ;	     BL be used if TIME is being parsed.
 22895

 22994                                  ; The table of special chars _$P_FileSp_Char should be initialized on every
 22995                                  ;entry to SysParse. This is in the non-checksum region and any program that
 22996                                  ;corrupts this table but does not corrupt the checksum region will leave
 22997                                  ;command.com parsing in an inconsistent state.
 22998                                  ; NB: The special characters string has been hardcoded here. If any change
 22999                                  ;is made to it in psdata.inc, a corresponding change needs to be made here.
 23000

 23004 00001511 2EC706[DB14]2B3E        	mov	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char+4], '+>'
 23005 00001518 2EC706[DD14]3B3D        	mov 	word [cs:_$P_FileSp_Char+6], ';='
 23006                                  ;ENDIFtHHH

 23038

 23040 0000154B AC                      	lodsb				;AN000; Pick a operand from buffer

 23067 00001578 7506                    	jne	short _$P_PL00 		;AN000; then
 23068                                  
 23069 0000157A 2E800E[4914]01          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AC034; remember it in flag
 23070                                  _$P_PL00:				;AN000;
 23071 00001580 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000; ready to see next byte
 23072 00001581 E82E07                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; was it 1st byte of DBCS ?

 23414                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23415                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23416                                  ;
 23417                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23418                                  ;
 23419                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23420                                  ;	    AL = type
 23421                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23422                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23423                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23424                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23425                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23426                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 23427                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 23428                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23429                                  ;
 23430                                  ; Output:   None
 23431                                  ;
 23432                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 23433                                  ;
 23434                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 23435                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23436                                  
 23437                                  _$P_Fill_Result:

 23522                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23523                                  ; _$P_Check_Match_Flags
 23524                                  ;
 23525                                  ; Function:  Check the mutch_flags and make the exit code and set the
 23526                                  ;	     result buffer
 23527                                  ;
 23528                                  ;	    Check for types in this order:
 23529                                  ;		Complex
 23530                                  ;		Date
 23531                                  ;		Time
 23532                                  ;		Drive
 23533                                  ;		Filespec
 23534                                  ;		Quoted String
 23535                                  ;		Simple String
 23536                                  ;
 23537                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 23538                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block

 23540                                  ; Output:    None
 23541                                  ;
 23542                                  ; Use:	     _$P_Value, P$_SValue, _$P_Simple_String, _$P_Date_Format
 23543                                  ;	     _$P_Time_Format, _$P_Complex_Format, _$P_File_Foemat
 23544                                  ;	     _$P_Drive_Format

 23547                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0

 23637                                  ; _$P_Remove_Colon;
 23638                                  ;
 23639                                  ; Function: Remove colon at end
 23640                                  ;
 23641                                  ; Input:    cs:SI points to string buffer to be examineed
 23642                                  ;
 23643                                  ; Output:   None
 23644                                  ;
 23645                                  ; Use:	_$P_Chk_DBCS
 23646                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23647                                  
 23648                                  _$P_Remove_Colon:
 23649 00001851 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 23650 00001852 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 23651                                  _$P_RCOL_Loop:				;AN000;
 23652 00001853 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 23653 00001856 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 23654 00001858 741A                    	jz	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; if yes, just exit
 23655                                  
 23656 0000185A 3C3A                    	cmp	al,_$P_Colon		;AN000; is it colon ?
 23657 0000185C 750D                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000;
 23658                                  
 23659 0000185E 2E807C0100              	cmp	byte [cs:si+1],_$P_NULL ;AN000; if so, next is NULL ?
 23660 00001863 7506                    	jne	short _$P_RCOL00	;AN000; no, then next char
 23661                                  
 23662 00001865 2EC60400                	mov	byte [cs:si],_$P_NULL	;AN000; yes, remove colon
 23663 00001869 EB09                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Exit	;AN000; and exit.
 23664                                  
 23665                                  _$P_RCOL00:				;AN000;
 23666 0000186B E84404                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; if not colon, then check if
 23667 0000186E 7301                    	jnc	short _$P_RCOL01	;AN000; DBCS leading byte.
 23668                                  
 23669 00001870 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; if yes, skip trailing byte
 23670                                  _$P_RCOL01:				;AN000;
 23671 00001871 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; si points to next byte
 23672 00001872 EBDF                    	jmp	short _$P_RCOL_Loop	;AN000; loop until NULL encountered
 23673                                  
 23674                                  _$P_RCOL_Exit:				;AN000;
 23675 00001874 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 23676 00001875 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 23677 00001876 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 23679                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23680                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_String;
 23681                                  ;
 23682                                  ; Function: Perform capitalization along with the file case map table
 23683                                  ;	    or character case map table.
 23684                                  ;
 23685                                  ; Input:    AL = 2 : Use character table
 23686                                  ;	    AL = 4 : Use file table
 23687                                  ;	    cs:SI points to string buffer to be capitalized
 23688                                  ;

 23690                                  ;
 23691                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23692                                  ;***********************************************************************

 23694                                  _$P_Do_CAPS_String:
 23695 00001877 56                      	push	si			;AN000;

 23698                                  
 23699                                  _$P_DCS_Loop:				;AN000;
 23700 0000187B 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; load charater and
 23701 0000187E E83104                  	call	_$P_Chk_DBCS		;AN000; check if DBCS leading byte
 23702 00001881 720C                    	jc	short _$P_DCS00		;AN000; if yes, do not need CAPS
 23703                                  
 23704 00001883 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of string ?
 23705 00001885 740C                    	jz	short _$P_DCS_Exit	;AN000; then exit.
 23706                                  
 23707 00001887 E80C00                  	call	_$P_Do_CAPS_Char 	;AN000; Here a SBCS char need to be CAPS
 23708 0000188A 2E8804                  	mov	[cs:si],al		;AN000; stored upper case char to buffer
 23709 0000188D EB01                    	jmp	short _$P_DCS01		;AN000; process next
 23710                                  _$P_DCS00:				;AN000;

 23712                                  _$P_DCS01:				;AN000;

 23715                                  _$P_DCS_Exit:				;AN000;

 23718 00001895 C3                      	retn

 23721                                  ; _$P_Do_CAPS_Char;
 23722                                  ;
 23723                                  ; Function: Perform capitalization along with the file case map table
 23724                                  ;	    or character case map table.
 23725                                  ;
 23726                                  ; Input:    DL = 2 : Use character table
 23727                                  ;	    DL = 4 : Use file table
 23728                                  ;	    AL = character to be capitalized
 23729                                  ;
 23730                                  ; Output:   None
 23731                                  ;
 23732                                  ; Use:	INT 21h /w AH=65h

 23734                                  
 23735                                  _$P_Do_CAPS_Char:
 23736 00001896 3C80                    	cmp	al,_$P_ASCII80	;80h	;AN000; need upper case table ?

 23740 0000189C 723C                    	jb	short _$P_CAPS_Ret	;AN000;   check if  "a" <= AL <= "z"
 23741

 23744

 23747                                  
 23748                                  _$P_DCC_Go:				;AN000;
 23749 000018A6 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 23750 000018A7 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 23751 000018A8 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 23752

 23756 000018AD 2E3815                  	cmp	[cs:di],dl		;AN000; already got table address ?
 23757 000018B0 7417                    	je	short _$P_DCC01		;AN000; if no,
 23758                                  
 23759                                  ;In this next section, ES will be used to pass a 5 byte workarea to INT 21h,
 23760                                  ; the GET COUNTYRY INFO call. This usage of ES is required by the function
 23761                                  ; call, regardless of what base register is currently be defined as cs.

 23768                                  					;(Note: this used to push CS.  BUG...

 23770                                  					;get extended country information

 23784                                  
 23785                                  ;In this next section, ES will be used as the base of the XLAT table, provided

 23787                                  ; regardless of which base reg is currently the cs reg.

 23804                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23805                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 23806                                  ;
 23807                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 23808                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 23809                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 23810                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 23811                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 23812                                  ;
 23813                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 23814                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23815                                  ;

 24039                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 24040                                  ;
 24041                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 24042                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 24043                                  ;
 24044                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 24045                                  ;
 24046                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 24047                                  ;
 24048                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 24049                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24050                                  
 24051                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24052                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 24053 000019F0 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 24054 000019F1 2EF606[4914]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 24055 000019F7 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 24056                                  
 24057 000019F9 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 24058 000019FA C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24059                                  
 24060                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 24061 000019FB 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 24062 000019FC 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 24063                                  
 24064 000019FE F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 24065 000019FF C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 24066                                  
 24067                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 24068 00001A00 F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 24069 00001A01 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 24184                                  ; _$P_String_Comp:
 24185                                  ;
 24186                                  ; Function:  Compare two string
 24187                                  ;
 24188                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> 1st string
 24189                                  ;	     ES:BP -> 2nd string  (Must be upper case)
 24190                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 24191                                  ;
 24192                                  ; Output:    CY = 1 if not match
 24193                                  ;
 24194                                  ; Use:	_$P_Chk_DBCS, _$P_Do_CAPS_Char

 24548                                  ; _$P_Skip_Delim;
 24549                                  ;
 24550                                  ; Function: Skip delimiters specified in the PARMS list, white space
 24551                                  ;	    and comma.
 24552                                  ;
 24553                                  ; Input:    DS:SI -> Command String
 24554                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 24555                                  ;
 24556                                  ; Output:   CY = 1 if the end of line encounterd

 24558                                  ;	    AL = Last examineed character
 24559                                  ;
 24560                                  ; Use:	    _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim,
 24561                                  ;
 24562                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)

 24564

 24569 00001BE2 7417                    	jz	short _$P_Skip_Delim_CY	;AN000; if yes, exit w/ CY on
 24570                                  
 24571 00001BE4 E85000                  	call	_$P_Chk_Delim		;AN000; is it one of delimiters ?
 24572 00001BE7 7515                    	jnz	short _$P_Skip_Delim_NCY ;AN000; if no, exit w/ CY off
 24573                                  
 24574 00001BE9 2EF606[4914]20          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra ;AC034; extra delim or comma found ?
 24575 00001BEF 74ED                    	jz	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Loop ;AN000; if no, loop
 24576                                  
 24577 00001BF1 2EF606[4914]41          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW+_$P_equ ;AC034; /x , or xxx=zzz , (tm08)
 24578 00001BF7 7407                    	jz	short _$P_Exit_At_Extra	;AN000; no switch, no keyword (tm08)
 24579                                  
 24580                                  	;dec	si			;AN000; backup si for next call (tm08)
 24581                                  	;jmp	short _$P_Exit_At_Extra	;AN000; else exit w/ CY off
 24582                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24583                                  	; cf=0
 24584 00001BF9 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit
 24585                                  
 24586                                  _$P_Skip_Delim_CY:			;AN000;
 24587 00001BFB F9                      	stc				;AN000; indicate EOL
 24588 00001BFC EB01                    	jmp	short _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24589                                  
 24590                                  _$P_Skip_Delim_NCY:			;AN000;
 24591 00001BFE F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate non delim
 24592                                  _$P_Skip_Delim_Exit:			;AN000; in this case, need
 24593 00001BFF 4E                      	dec	si			;AN000;  backup index pointer
 24594                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24595                                  _$P_Exit_At_Extra:	 ; cf=0
 24596 00001C00 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24597                                  
 24598                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24599                                  ;_$P_Exit_At_Extra:			;AN000;
 24600                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate extra delim
 24601                                  	;retn				;AN000;
 24602                                  
 24603                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24604                                  ; _$P_Chk_EOL;
 24605                                  ;
 24606                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of End of Line characters.
 24607                                  ;
 24608                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24609                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 24610                                  ;
 24611                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of End of Line characters
 24612                                  ;**********************************************************************
 24613                                  
 24614                                  _$P_Chk_EOL:
 24615 00001C01 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 24616 00001C02 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24617 00001C03 3C0D                    	cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; Carriage return ?
 24618 00001C05 742D                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24619                                  
 24620 00001C07 3C00                    	cmp	al,_$P_NULL		;AN000; zero ?
 24621 00001C09 7429                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24622                                  
 24623                                  ;IF LFEOLSW				;AN028; IF LF TO BE ACCEPTED AS EOL
 24624 00001C0B 3C0A                    	cmp	al,_$P_LF		;AN000; Line feed ?
 24625 00001C0D 7425                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24626                                  ;ENDIF					;AN028;
 24627                                  
 24628 00001C0F 26807D0202              	cmp	byte [es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_EOL 
 24629                                  					;AN000; EOL character specified ?
 24630 00001C14 721E                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24631                                  
 24632 00001C16 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx			;AN000;
 24633 00001C18 268A5D03                	mov	bl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim]
 24634                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 24635 00001C1C 83C304                  	add	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS 	;AN000; skip it
 24636 00001C1F 26803900                	cmp	byte [es:bx+di],_$P_I_Use_Default ;AN000; No extra EOL character ?
 24637 00001C23 740D                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ	;AN000;
 24638                                  
 24639                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000; Get number of extra character
 24640 00001C25 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 24641 00001C27 268A09                  	mov	cl,[es:bx+di]		;AN000;
 24642                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Loop:			;AN000;
 24643 00001C2A 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 24644 00001C2B 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra EOL character
 24645 00001C2E 7404                    	je	short _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit 	;AN000;
 24646                                  
 24647 00001C30 E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_EOL_Loop 	;AN000;
 24648                                  
 24649                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_NZ:				;AN000;
 24650 00001C32 3C0D                    	cmp	al,_$P_CR		;AN000; reset ZF
 24651                                  _$P_Chk_EOL_Exit:			;AN000;
 24652 00001C34 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24653 00001C35 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 24654 00001C36 C3                      	retn
 24655                                  
 24656                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24657                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 24658                                  ;
 24659                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 24660                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 24661                                  ;	    blanks.
 24662                                  ;
 24663                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24664                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 24665                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 24666                                  ;
 24667                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 24668                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 24669                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 24670                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24671                                  
 24672                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 24673 00001C37 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 24674 00001C38 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24675 00001C39 2EC606[4314]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 24676                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 24677                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 24678 00001C3F 2E8026[4914]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 24679 00001C45 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 24680 00001C47 7436                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24681                                  
 24682 00001C49 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 24683 00001C4B 7432                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24684                                  
 24685 00001C4D 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 24686 00001C4F 7431                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 24687                                  
 24688                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 24689                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 24690 00001C51 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 24691 00001C53 750C                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 24692                                  
 24693 00001C55 803C20                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 24694 00001C58 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 24695                                  
 24696 00001C5A B020                    	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 24697 00001C5C 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 24698 00001C5D 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 24699 00001C5F EB1E                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24700                                  
 24701                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 24702 00001C61 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 24703                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 24704 00001C66 7217                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24705                                  
 24706                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 24707 00001C68 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 24708                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 24709 00001C6A 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 24710                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 24711 00001C6E 09C9                    	or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 24712 00001C70 740B                    	jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 24713                                  
 24714 00001C72 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 24715                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 24716 00001C75 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 24717 00001C76 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character
 24718 00001C79 7407                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 24719                                  
 24720 00001C7B E2F8                    	loop	_$P_Chk_Delim_Loop	;AN000; examine all extra delimiter
 24721                                  
 24722                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ:			;AN000;
 24723 00001C7D 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space		;AN000; reset ZF
 24724                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit:			;AN000;
 24725                                  _$P_ChkDfin:				;AN000;
 24726 00001C7F 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24727 00001C80 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000;
 24728 00001C81 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24729                                  
 24730                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0:			;AN000;
 24731 00001C82 2EA2[4314]              	mov	[cs:_$P_Terminator],al ;AC034; keep terminated delimiter
 24732 00001C86 2EF606[4914]01          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_equ ;AN027;AC034;; if terminating a key=
 24733 00001C8C 7506                    	jnz	short _$P_No_Set_Extra 	;AN027; then do not set the EXTRA bit
 24734                                  
 24735 00001C8E 2E800E[4914]20          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra 
 24736                                  					;AC034; flag terminated extra delimiter or comma
 24737                                  _$P_No_Set_Extra:			;AN027;
 24738 00001C94 38C0                    	cmp	al,al			;AN000; set ZF
 24739 00001C96 EBE7                    	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 24740                                  
 24741                                  
 24742                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24743                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 24744                                  ;
 24745                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 24746                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 24747                                  ;
 24748                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 24749                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 24750                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 24751                                  ;
 24752                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 24753                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 24754                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 24755                                  
 24756                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 24757                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 24758                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 24759                                  ;
 24760                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 24761                                  
 24762                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 24763                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24764                                  
 24765                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 24766                                  	;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 24767 00001C98 8D2E[5214]              	lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	; BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 24768                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 24769 00001C9C 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 24770 00001C9E 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 24771                                  
 24772                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 24773 00001CA0 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24774 00001CA2 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 24775                                  
 24776 00001CA4 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 24777                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24778                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24779 00001CA5 C3                      	retn
 24780                                  
 24781                                  ; 12/12/2022
 24782                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 24783                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 24784                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24785                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 24786                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 24787                                  
 24788                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 24789                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 24790 00001CA6 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 24791 00001CA8 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 24792                                  
 24793 00001CAA 2E800E[4914]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 24794                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 24795                                  
 24796                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24797                                  	; cf=0
 24798                                  	;retn
 24799                                  
 24800                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 24801                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24802                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 24803 00001CB0 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 24804                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 24805                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 24806 00001CB1 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24807                                  
 24808                                  ;**************************************************************************
 24809                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24810                                  ;
 24811                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 24812                                  ;
 24813                                  ;  Input:
 24814                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 24815                                  ;
 24816                                  ;  Output:
 24817                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 24818                                  ;
 24819                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 24820                                  ;
 24821                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 24822                                  ;***************************************************************************
 24823                                  
 24824                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 24825 00001CB2 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 24826 00001CB3 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 24827 00001CB4 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24828                                  	
 24829 00001CB5 2E833E[4614]00          	cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 24830 00001CBB 7527                    	jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 24831                                  
 24832 00001CBD 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 24833 00001CBE 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24834 00001CBF 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 24835 00001CC0 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 24836 00001CC1 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 24837 00001CC2 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 24838 00001CC3 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 24839 00001CC4 31F6                    	xor	si,si			;AN000;
 24840 00001CC6 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si			;AN000;
 24841 00001CC8 B80063                  	MOV	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 24842 00001CCB CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 24843                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 24844 00001CCD 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24845 00001CCF 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24846 00001CD1 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 24847 00001CD2 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 24848 00001CD3 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 24849 00001CD4 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 24850 00001CD5 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 24851 00001CD6 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 24852 00001CD7 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 24853 00001CD8 7429                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 24854                                  
 24855                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 24856 00001CDA 2E8936[4414]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 24857 00001CDF 2E891E[4614]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 24858                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 24859 00001CE4 2E8B36[4414]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 24860 00001CE9 2E8E1E[4614]            	mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 24861                                  
 24862                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 24863 00001CEE 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 24864 00001CF1 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 24865                                  
 24866 00001CF3 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 24867 00001CF5 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 24868                                  
 24869 00001CF7 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 24870 00001CFA 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 24871                                  
 24872 00001CFC F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 24873 00001CFD EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 24874                                  
 24875                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 24876 00001CFF 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 24877 00001D00 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 24878                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 24879 00001D01 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 24880                                  
 24881                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 24882                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24883                                  	; cf=0
 24884                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 24885                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 24886 00001D03 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 24887 00001D04 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 24888 00001D05 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 24889 00001D06 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 24901                                  struc p_parms
 24902 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?
 24903 00000002 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; an extra delimiter list
 24904 00000003 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; length is 1
 24905 00000004 ??                      	resb 	1	; db ';' ; delimiter
 24906                                  .size:
 24907                                  endstruc
 24908                                  
 24909                                  struc p_pos
 24910 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; numeric value??
 24911 00000002 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; function
 24912 00000004 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; result value buffer
 24913                                  
 24914                                  ; note: by defining result_val before this structure, we could remove
 24915                                  ;  the "result_val" from every structure invocation
 24916                                  
 24917 00000006 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; value list
 24918 00000008 ??                      	resb	1	; db 0	; no switches/keywords
 24919                                  .size:
 24920                                  endstruc
 24921                                  
 24922                                  struc	p_range
 24923 00000000 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; range definition
 24924 00000001 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; 1 definition of range
 24925 00000002 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; item tag for this range
 24926 00000003 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric min
 24927 00000007 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric max
 24928                                  .size:
 24929                                  endstruc

 24933                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 24934                                  	; (SYSINIT:1F48h)
 24935                                  
 24936                                  ; buffer = [n | n,m] {/e}
 24937                                  
 24938                                  ;buf_parms p_parms <buf_parmsx>
 24939                                  buf_parms: 
 24940 00001D07 [0C1D]                  	dw	buf_parmsx
 24941 00001D09 01                      	db	1	; an extra delimiter list
 24942 00001D0A 01                      	db	1	; length is 1
 24943 00001D0B 3B                      	db	';'	; delimiter
 24944                                  
 24945                                  buf_parmsx:
 24946 00001D0C 0102[161D][2A1D]        	dw	201h,buf_pos1,buf_pos2	; min 1, max 2 positionals
 24947 00001D12 01                      	db	1			; one switch
 24948 00001D13 [3E1D]                  	dw	sw_x_ctrl
 24949 00001D15 00                      	db	0			; no keywords
 24950                                  
 24951                                  ;buf_pos1 p_pos <8000h,0,result_val,buf_range_1>  ; numeric
 24952                                  buf_pos1:
 24953 00001D16 0080                    	dw	8000h	; numeric value??
 24954 00001D18 0000                    	dw	0	; function
 24955 00001D1A [501D]                  	dw	result_val ; result value buffer	
 24956 00001D1C [1F1D]                  	dw	buf_range_1 ; value list
 24957 00001D1E 00                      	db	0  	; no switches/keywords
 24958                                  
 24959                                  ;buf_range_1 p_range <,,,1,99>		; M050
 24960                                  buf_range_1:
 24961 00001D1F 01                      	db	1	; range definition
 24962 00001D20 01                      	db	1	; 1 definition of range
 24963 00001D21 01                      	db	1	; item tag for this range
 24964 00001D22 01000000                	dd	1	; numeric min
 24965 00001D26 63000000                	dd	99	; numeric max
 24966                                  
 24967                                  ;buf_pos2 p_pos <8001h,0,result_val,buf_range_2> ; optional num.
 24968                                  buf_pos2:
 24969 00001D2A 0180                    	dw	8001h
 24970 00001D2C 0000                    	dw	0
 24971 00001D2E [501D]                  	dw	result_val	
 24972 00001D30 [331D]                  	dw	buf_range_2
 24973 00001D32 00                      	db	0
 24974                                  
 24975                                  ;buf_range_2 p_range <,,,0,8>
 24976                                  buf_range_2:

 25443                                  ;include	highvar.inc	; devicehigh variables (used by loadhigh also)
 25444                                  
 25445                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25446                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25447                                  
 25448                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 25449                                  ;
 25450                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 25451                                  ;
 25452                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25453                                  ;
 25454                                  ;   Modification log:
 25455                                  ;
 25456                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 25457                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 25458                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 25459                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 25460                                  ;
 25461                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25462                                  ;
 25463                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 25464                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 25465                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 25466                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 25467                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 25468                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 25469                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 25470                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 25471                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 25472                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 25473                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 25474                                  ;
 25475                                  ;******************************************************************************
 25476                                  
 25477                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 25478                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 25479                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 25480                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 25481                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 25482                                  
 25483                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 25484                                  
 25485                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 25486                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 25487                                  
 25488                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 25489                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 25490                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 25491                                  
 25492                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 25493                                  ;
 25494                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 25495                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 25496                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 25497                                  ;	           line.
 25498                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 25499                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 25500                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 25501                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 25502                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 25503                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 25504                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 25505                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 25506                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 25507                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 25508                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 25509                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 25510                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 25511                                  ;	           for details).
 25512                                  
 25513                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 25514                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 25515                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 25516                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 25517                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 25518                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 25519                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 25520                                  fm_strat: db	0
 25521                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 25522                                  
 25523                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 25524                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 25525                                  
 25526                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 25527                                  
 25528                                  %endif
 25529                                  
 25530                                  ;****************************************************************** RICHID ****
 25531                                  
 25532                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, SYSCONF.ASM)
 25533                                  ; ((MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS -> SYNINIT:22BAh))
 25534                                  
 25535                                  ; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25536                                  ; (SYSINIT:212Bh)	
 25537                                  
 25538                                  		;public	DevEntry
 25539                                  
 25540 00001EEA 0000                    DevSize:	dw	0	; size of the device driver being loaded(paras)
 25541 00001EEC 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 25542 00001EEE 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 25543 00001EF0 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver
 25544 00001EF4 00000000                DevBrkAddr:	dd	0	; Break address of the device driver
 25545                                  ; 27/10/2022 
 25546                                  ;ConvLoad:	db	0	; Use conventional (dos 5 -style) InitDevLoad?
 25547                                  ;
 25548 00001EF8 00                      DevUMB:		db	0	; byte indicating whether to load DDs in UMBs
 25549 00001EF9 0000                    DevUMBAddr:	dw	0	; cuurent UMB used fro loading devices (paras)
 25550 00001EFB 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)
 25551 00001EFD 0000                    DevUMBFree:	dw	0	; Start of free are in the current UMB (paras)
 25552                                  ;
 25553 00001EFF 00000000                DevXMSAddr:	dd	0
 25554                                  ;
 25555 00001F03 0000                    DevExecAddr:	dw	0	; Device load address parameter to Exec call
 25556 00001F05 0000                    DevExecReloc:	dw	0	; Device load relocation factor
 25557                                  ;
 25558 00001F07 00                      DeviceHi:	db	0	; Flag indicating whther the current device
 25559                                  				;  is being loaded into UMB
 25560 00001F08 0000                    DevSizeOption:	dw	0	; SIZE= option
 25561                                  ;
 25562 00001F0A 00                      Int12Lied:	db	0	; did we trap int 12 ?
 25563 00001F0B 0000                    OldInt12Mem:	dw	0	; value in 40:13h (int 12 ram)
 25564 00001F0D 50524F544D414E24        ThreeComName:	db	'PROTMAN$'	; 3Com Device name
 25565                                  ;
 25566 00001F15 00                      FirstUMBLinked:	db	0
 25567 00001F16 0000                    DevDOSData:	dw	0	; segment of DOS Data
 25568 00001F18 00000000                DevCmdLine:	dd	0	; Current Command line
 25569 00001F1C 00                      DevSavedDelim:	db	0	; The delimiter which was replaced with null
 25570                                  				; to use the file name in the command line
 25571                                  ;
 25572                                  ;	ifdef	dblspace_hooks
 25573                                  ;MagicHomeFlag:	db	0	; set non-zero when MagicDrv is final placed
 25574                                  ;	endif
 25575

 25639

 25641 00001F55 A3[4C03]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 25642 00001F58 E866F1                  	call	ParaRound
 25643 00001F5B 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 25644                                  
 25645                                  ; 27/10/2022
 25646                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25647                                  ;;
 25648                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 25649                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 25650                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 25651                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 25652                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 25653                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 25654                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 25655                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 25656                                  ;;
 25657                                  ;       dec     dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 25658                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for

 25672

 25674 00001F6E 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 25675                                  
 25676 00001F70 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 25677 00001F72 2E8B0E[D203]            	mov	cx,[cs:count]
 25678 00001F77 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 25679                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh

 25681 00001F7A CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 25682 00001F7C 9C                      	pushf
 25683                                  
 25684                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 25685                                  
 25686 00001F7D 50                      	push	ax
 25687 00001F7E 57                      	push	di
 25688 00001F7F 51                      	push	cx
 25689 00001F80 B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 25690 00001F82 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 25691 00001F84 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 25692 00001F86 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 25693 00001F88 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 25694                                  
 25695                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 25696                                  
 25697 00001F8A 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 25698                                  
 25699                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 25700                                  
 25701                                  puteol:
 25702 00001F8B B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 25703 00001F8D AA                      	stosb
 25704 00001F8E B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 25705 00001F90 AA                      	stosb
 25706 00001F91 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 25707                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25708                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 25709                                  
 25710                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 25711                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 25712 00001F93 0E                      	push	cs
 25713 00001F94 1F                      	pop	ds
 25714                                  
 25715 00001F95 893E[D203]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 25716                                  
 25717 00001F99 59                      	pop	cx
 25718 00001F9A 5F                      	pop	di
 25719 00001F9B 58                      	pop	ax
 25720                                  
 25721                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25722                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25723                                  	;push	cs
 25724                                  	;pop	ds
 25725                                  
 25726 00001F9C 50                      	push	ax
 25727                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 25728 00001F9D B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 25729 00001F9F CD21                    	int	21h
 25730 00001FA1 58                      	pop	ax
 25731 00001FA2 9D                      	popf
 25732 00001FA3 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 25733 00001FA5 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 25734 00001FA7 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 25735                                  conferr:
 25736 00001FA9 BA[7C34]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 25737 00001FAC E8AC13                  	call	badfil
 25738                                  endconv:
 25739 00001FAF C3                      	retn
 25740                                  
 25741                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25742                                  ;
 25743                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 25744                                  ;
 25745                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands
 25746                                  ;

 25748                                  
 25749                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25750                                  multi_pass:
 25751 00001FB0 0E                      	push	cs
 25752 00001FB1 1F                      	pop	ds
 25753                                  
 25754 00001FB2 803E[4903]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 25755                                  ;jae_endconv:
 25756 00001FB7 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 25757                                  
 25758                                  	;push	word [CONFBOT]
 25759                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25760 00001FB9 FF36[A102]              	push	word [top_of_cdss]
 25761 00001FBD 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 25762                                  
 25763 00001FBE 8B36[D403]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 25764 00001FC2 8936[D203]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 25765 00001FC6 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 25766 00001FC8 8936[D603]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 25767 00001FCC 8936[2B03]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 25768                                  
 25769 00001FD0 E86807                  	call	getchr
 25770 00001FD3 EB06                    	jmp	short conflp
 25771                                  
 25772                                  getcom:
 25773 00001FD5 E8B10E                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 25774 00001FD8 E86007                  	call	getchr
 25775                                  conflp: 
 25776 00001FDB 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 25777                                  
 25778 00001FDD FF06[2B03]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 25779                                  
 25780 00001FE1 C606[3314]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 25781 00001FE6 C606[3614]00            	mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 25782 00001FEB 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 25783 00001FED 7416                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 25784                                  
 25785                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25786                                  %if 0
 25787                                  
 25788                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25789                                  
 25790                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 25791                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 25792                                  
 25793                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 25794                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 25795                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 25796                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 25797                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 25798                                  
 25799                                          push    ax                      ;
 25800                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 25801                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 25802                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 25803                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 25804                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 25805                                          pop     ax
 25806                                  ;
 25807                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 25808                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 25809                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 25810                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 25811                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 25812                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 25813                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 25814                                  ;   spot.
 25815                                  ;
 25816                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 25817                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 25818                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 25819                                  ;   retrieved.
 25820                                  ;
 25821                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 25822                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25823                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 25824                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25825                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 25826                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 25827                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 25828                                  final:                                  ;
 25829                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 25830                                  not_final:                              ;
 25831                                  ;endif
 25832                                  
 25833                                  %endif
 25834 00001FEF 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 25835 00001FF1 E84707                  	call	getchr
 25836 00001FF4 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 25837                                  
 25838 00001FF6 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 25839                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 25840                                  	; 27/10/2022
 25841 00001FFB 73B2                    	jnb	short endconv	
 25842 00001FFD E90707                  	jmp	badop
 25843                                  	
 25844                                  coff:	
 25845                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25846                                  	; ds = cs
 25847                                  	;push	cs
 25848                                  	;pop	ds
 25849 00002000 E89D10                  	call	newline

 25851

 25853 00002005 E83307                  	call	getchr
 25854 00002008 EBD1                    	jmp	short conflp
