 25856                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25857                                  ; 11/12/2022
 25858                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 25859                                  ;coff_p:
 25860                                  	;push	cs
 25861                                  	;pop	ds
 25862                                  
 25863                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 25864                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 25865                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 25866                                  ;install= command.
 25867                                  
 25868                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25869                                  ;install command
 25870                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25871                                  
 25872                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 25873                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 25874                                  tryi:
 25875 0000200A 803E[4903]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI
 25876 0000200F 7503                    	jne	short not_init_pass
 25877 00002011 E92301                  	jmp	multi_try_doshi
 25878                                  not_init_pass:
 25879 00002014 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; the second pass was for ifs=
 25880                                          ; 11/12/2022
 25881                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2	; now it is NOPs
 25882 00002019 74E5                    	je	short coff
 25883                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25884                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 25885                                  					; This pass can be made use of if
 25886                                  					; we want do some config.sys process
 25887                                  					; after device drivers are loaded
 25888                                  					; and before install= commands
 25889                                  					; are processed
 25890                                  
 25891 0000201B 803E[4903]03            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; the third pass for install= ?
 25892 00002020 7411                    	je	short multi_try_i
 25893 00002022 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 25894                                  	; 11/12/2022
 25895                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2
 25896 00002025 74D9                    	je	short coff
 25897                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25898                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff	
 25899                                  
 25900                                  ;       make note of any INSTALL= or INSTALLHIGH= commands we find,
 25901                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 25902                                          
 25903 00002027 80FC49                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I'	; install= command?
 25904                                  	;jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.
 25905                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25906 0000202A 752A                    	jne	short tryb	
 25907                                  	
 25908                                  	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; set the flag
 25909 0000202C 800E[4A03]01            	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25910                                  multi_pass_coff2:
 25911 00002031 EBCD                    	jmp	short coff ; 13/05/2019	; and handles the next command
 25912                                  
 25913                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25914                                  ;precheck_installhigh:
 25915                                  ;       cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 25916                                  ;       jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing
 25917                                  ;	;or	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 25918                                  ;	or	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 25919                                  ;       jmp	short coff
 25920                                  
 25921                                  multi_try_i:
 25922 00002033 80FC49                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?
 25923                                  	;jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh
 25924                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25925 00002036 7505                    	jne	short multi_pass_filter
 25926                                  
 25927                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25928                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25929                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 25930                                  ;       jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 25931                                  ;;endif
 25932                                  
 25933 00002038 E806F0                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 25934 0000203B EBC3                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 25935                                  
 25936                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 25937                                  %if 0
 25938                                  
 25939                                  multi_try_n:
 25940                                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 25941                                          jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 25942                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 25943                                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 25944                                          jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 25945                                  ;endif
 25946                                  
 25947                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 25948                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 25949                                  
 25950                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 25951                                  	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 25952                                  	mov	bx,ax
 25953                                          push    bx                      ; save for the return
 25954                                  
 25955                                          or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 25956                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 25957                                  	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 25958                                  
 25959                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 25960                                          int     21h                     ; get link state
 25961                                          xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 25962                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 25963                                  
 25964                                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 25965                                  	mov	bx,1
 25966                                  	int	21h			;link in UMBs
 25967                                  
 25968                                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 25969                                  
 25970                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 25971                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 25972                                          int     21h
 25973                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 25974                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 25975                                          int     21h
 25976                                  
 25977                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 25978                                  
 25979                                  %endif
 25980                                  
 25981                                  multi_pass_filter:
 25982 0000203D 80FC59                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_COMMENT ; 'Y' ; comment?
 25983 00002040 740A                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 25984 00002042 80FC5A                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_UNKNOWN ; 'Z' ; bad command?
 25985 00002045 7405                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 25986 00002047 80FC30                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_REM  ; '0' 	; rem?
 25987 0000204A 7508                    	jne	short multi_pass_coff 	; ignore the rest of the commands.
 25988                                  
 25989                                  multi_pass_adjust:			; these commands need to
 25990 0000204C FF0E[D603]              	dec	word [chrptr]		;  adjust chrptr,count

 26001                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26002                                  ;									      *
 26003                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 26004                                  ;									      *
 26005                                  ; input :								      *
 26006                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26007                                  ; output:								      *
 26008                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 26009                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 26010                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 26011                                  ;									      *
 26012                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26013                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26014                                  ; logic:								      *
 26015                                  ; {									      *
 26016                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *

 26021                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26022                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 26023                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 26024                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 26025                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 26026                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 26027                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 26028                                  ;	};								      *
 26029                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 26030                                  ; };									      *
 26031                                  ;									      *
 26032                                  ;******************************************************************************

 26124                                  ;****************************************************************************
 26125                                  ;									    *
 26126                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *

 27548                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27549                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 27550                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 27551                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 27552                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 27553                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 27554                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 27555                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 27556                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 27557                                  
 27558                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27559                                  ;									  *
 27560                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 27561                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 27562                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 27563                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 27564                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 27565                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 27566                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 27567                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 27568                                  ; input :								  *
 27569                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 27570                                  ; output:								  *
 27571                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 27572                                  ;									  *
 27573                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 27574                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 27575                                  ; logic:								  *
 27576                                  ; {									  *
 27577                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 27578                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 27579                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 27580                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 27581                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 27582                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 27583                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27584                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 27585                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 27586                                  ;	     }								  *
 27587                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 27588                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 27589                                  ;	};								  *
 27590                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 27591                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 27592                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 27593                                  ; };									  *
 27594                                  ;**************************************************************************
 27595

 28263                                  sysinit_parse:
 28264                                  
 28265                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28266                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 28267                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 28268                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 28269                                  ;
 28270                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 28271                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 28272                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 28273                                  ;	*** after each call.
 28274                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 28275                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 28276                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 28277                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 28278                                  ;	 procedure.
 28279                                  ;	ax - exit code
 28280                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 28281                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 28282                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 28283                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 28284                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28285                                  
 28286                                  	; 24/10/2022
 28287 000026E4 06                      	push	es			;save es,ds
 28288 000026E5 1E                      	push	ds

 28290 000026E6 06                      	push	es
 28291 000026E7 1F                      	pop	ds			;now ds:si -> command line
 28292                                  
 28293 000026E8 0E                      	push	cs

 28295                                  
 28296 000026EA 2E8C1E[3914]            	mov	[cs:badparm_seg],ds	;save the pointer to the parm

 28299                                  	; 04/01/2023

 28305                                  
 28306                                  	;je	short ll4

 28610                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 28611                                  ;
 28612                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 28613                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 28614                                  ;
 28615                                  ;	Output : none
 28616                                  ;
 28617                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 28618                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 28619                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28620                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 28621                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 28622                                  ;
 28623                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28624

 28626                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28627                                  	; ds = cs

 28630                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 28631 000027A7 E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 28632 000027AA 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 28633                                  	; 13/05/2019
 28634                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 28635                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 28636                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 28637                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28638                                  	; ds = cs
 28639 000027AC 803E[071F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 28640 000027B1 74F0                    	je	short limx
 28641 000027B3 A1[EE1E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 28642                                  lim_set:
 28643                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 28644                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28645                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 28646                                  ;limx:
 28647                                  	;retn
 28648                                  	
 28649                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 28650                                  
 28651                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28652                                  ;
 28653                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 28654                                  ;
 28655                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 28656                                  ;	Output : none
 28657                                  ;
 28658                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 28659                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 28660                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 28661                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 28662                                  ;
 28663                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28664                                  
 28665                                  	; 01/11/2022
 28666                                  SetInt12Mem:
 28667 000027B6 1E                      	push	ds
 28668 000027B7 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 28669 000027BA 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 28670 000027BC 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 28671 000027C0 2E891E[0B1F]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 28672 000027C5 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 28673 000027C7 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 28674 000027C9 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 28675 000027CC 2EC606[0A1F]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 28676 000027D2 1F                      	pop	ds
 28677                                  ;limx:
 28678 000027D3 C3                      	retn
 28679                                  
 28680                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28681                                  ;
 28682                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 28683                                  ;
 28684                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 28685                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 28686                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 28687                                  ;
 28688                                  ;	Output : none
 28689                                  ;

 28691                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 28692                                  ;
 28693                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28694                                  
 28695                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 28696                                  	; 11/12/2022
 28697                                  	; ds = cs
 28698 000027D4 803E[0A1F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0

 28701                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 28702 000027D9 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 28703                                  	; 18/12/2022
 28704 000027DB B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 28705 000027DE 8826[0A1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 28706                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 28707                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 28708 000027E2 1E                      	push	ds
 28709                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 28710 000027E3 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 28711 000027E5 2EA1[0B1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 28712 000027E9 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 28713 000027EC 1F                      	pop	ds
 28714                                  timx:
 28715 000027ED C3                      	retn

 28766                                  
 28767                                  %if 0
 28768                                  
 28769                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 28770                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 28771                                  
 28772                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28773                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 28774                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 28775                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28776                                  
 28777                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28778                                  ;
 28779                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 28780                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 28781                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 28782                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 28783                                  ;
 28784                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 28785                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 28786                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 28787                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 28788                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 28789                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 28790                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 28791                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 28792                                  ; available during the load.
 28793                                  ;
 28794                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 28795                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 28796                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 28797                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 28798                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 28799                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 28800                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 28801                                  ;
 28802                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 28803                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 28804                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 28805                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 28806                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 28807                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 28808                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 28809                                  ;
 28810                                  ;******************************************************************************
 28811                                  
 28812                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 28813                                  
 28814                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 28815                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 28816                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 28817                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 28818                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 28819                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 28820                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 28821                                  
 28822                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 28823                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 28824                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 28825                                  
 28826                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28827                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 28828                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28829                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 28830                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 28831                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 28832                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 28833                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28834                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 28835                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 28836                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28837                                  
 28838                                  InitVar:
 28839                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 28840                                  	push	ax
 28841                                  	push	cx
 28842                                  	push	di
 28843                                  	push	es
 28844                                  
 28845                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 28846                                  	push	cs
 28847                                  	pop	es
 28848                                  
 28849                                  	xor	ax,ax
 28850                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 28851                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 28852                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 28853                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 28854                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 28855                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 28856                                  
 28857                                  	cld
 28858                                  
 28859                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 28860                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 28861                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 28862                                  
 28863                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 28864                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 28865                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 28866                                  
 28867                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 28868                                  
 28869                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 28870                                  	pop	es
 28871                                  	pop	di
 28872                                  	pop	cx
 28873                                  	pop	ax	 	
 28874                                  
 28875                                  	retn
 28876                                  
 28877                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28878                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 28879                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28880                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 28881                                  ; EXIT    : None
 28882                                  ; ERROR   : None
 28883                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 28884                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28885                                  
 28886                                  FixMem:
 28887                                  	push	ax
 28888                                  	push	bx
 28889                                  	push	cx
 28890                                  	push	dx
 28891                                  	push	es
 28892                                  
 28893                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 28894                                  
 28895                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 28896                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 28897                                  
 28898                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 28899                                  
 28900                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 28901                                  
 28902                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 28903                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 28904                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 28905                                  
 28906                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 28907                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 28908                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 28909                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 28910                                  
 28911                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 28912                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 28913                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 28914                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 28915                                  
 28916                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 28917                                  
 28918                                  fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 28919                                  	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 28920                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 28921                                  
 28922                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 28923                                  	add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 28924                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 28925                                  
 28926                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 28927                                  
 28928                                  fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 28929                                  	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 28930                                  
 28931                                  	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 28932                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 28933                                  	inc	bx
 28934                                  	mov	es,bx
 28935                                  
 28936                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 28937                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 28938                                  	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 28939                                  fmX:	
 28940                                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 28941                                  
 28942                                  	pop	es
 28943                                  	pop	dx
 28944                                  	pop	cx
 28945                                  	pop	bx
 28946                                  	pop	ax
 28947                                  
 28948                                  	retn
 28949                                  
 28950                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28951                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 28952                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28953                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 28954                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 28955                                  ; ERROR:    None
 28956                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 28957                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28958                                  
 28959                                  fm_link:
 28960                                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 28961                                  	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 28962                                  
 28963                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 28964                                  	;
 28965                                  	;push	es
 28966                                  	;push	cs
 28967                                  	;pop	es
 28968                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 28969                                  	;pop	es
 28970                                  	
 28971                                  	mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 28972                                  
 28973                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 28974                                  	mov	bx,1
 28975                                  	int	21h
 28976                                  	retn
 28977                                  
 28978                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28979                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 28980                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28981                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 28982                                  ; EXIT:     None
 28983                                  ; ERROR:    None
 28984                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 28985                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28986                                  
 28987                                  fm_unlink:
 28988                                  	xor	bx,bx
 28989                                  	
 28990                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 28991                                  	;
 28992                                  	;push	ds
 28993                                  	;push	cs
 28994                                  	;pop	ds
 28995                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 28996                                  	;pop	ds
 28997                                  	
 28998                                  	mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 28999                                  
 29000                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29001                                  	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 29002                                  	retn
 29003                                  
 29004                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29005                                  
 29006                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29007                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 29008                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 29009                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29010                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 29011                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 29012                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 29013                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29014                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29015                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 29016                                  ;
 29017                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 29018                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 29019                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29020                                  ;
 29021                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 29022                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 29023                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 29024                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 29025                                  ;
 29026                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 29027                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 29028                                  ;
 29029                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29030                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 29031                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 29032                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 29033                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 29034                                  ;     lh
 29035                                  ;     /l
 29036                                  ;     1
 29037                                  ;     1000
 29038                                  ;     2
 29039                                  ;     print
 29040                                  ;     /d
 29041                                  ;     :lpt2
 29042                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 29043                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 29044                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 29045                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 29046                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 29047                                  ; for:
 29048                                  ;    Each /L
 29049                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 29050                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 29051                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 29052                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 29053                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 29054                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29055                                  
 29056                                  ParseVar:
 29057                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 29058                                  	push	di
 29059                                  	push	ds
 29060                                  	push	es
 29061                                  
 29062                                  	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 29063                                  	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 29064                                  	cld
 29065                                  
 29066                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29067                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 29068                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29069                                  
 29070                                  pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 29071                                  	call	isWhite
 29072                                  	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 29073                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29074                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH
 29075                                  	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 29076                                  
 29077                                  	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 29078                                  	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 29079                                  	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 29080                                  
 29081                                  pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 29082                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 29083                                  	and	al,0DFh
 29084                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 29085                                  	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 29086                                  	jne	short pv30
 29087                                  
 29088                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29089                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29090                                  
 29091                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 29092                                  	;
 29093                                  	;push	es
 29094                                  	;push	cs
 29095                                  	;pop	es
 29096                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 29097                                  	;pop	es
 29098                                  
 29099                                  	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 29100                                  
 29101                                  	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 29102                                  
 29103                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 29104                                  	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 29105                                  	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 29106                                  
 29107                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29108                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29109                                  
 29110                                  	call	parseL
 29111                                  	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 29112                                  
 29113                                  	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 29114                                  	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 29115                                  
 29116                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 29117                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29118                                  pvErr:	dec	si
 29119                                  	dec	si
 29120                                  	stc
 29121                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 29122                                  	pop	es
 29123                                  	pop	ds
 29124                                  	pop	di
 29125                                  	retn
 29126                                  
 29127                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29128                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 29129                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29130                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 29131                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 29132                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 29133                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 29134                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29135                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 29136                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 29137                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 29138                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 29139                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29140                                  
 29141                                  parseL:
 29142                                  	lodsb
 29143                                  	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 29144                                  	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 29145                                  
 29146                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29147                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 29148                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29149                                  
 29150                                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 29151                                  	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 29152                                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 29153                                  
 29154                                  	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 29155                                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 29156                                  	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 29157                                  
 29158                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 29159                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29160                                  
 29161                                  	lodsb
 29162                                  	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 29163                                  	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 29164                                  
 29165                                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 29166                                  	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 29167                                  
 29168                                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 29169                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29170                                  
 29171                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29172                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 29173                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 29174                                  
 29175                                  	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 29176                                  	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 29177                                  
 29178                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 29179                                  
 29180                                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 29181                                  	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 29182                                  
 29183                                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 29184                                  
 29185                                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 29186                                  
 29187                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 29188                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29189                                  
 29190                                  	lodsb
 29191                                  	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 29192                                  	je	short pl10	;
 29193                                  
 29194                                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 29195                                  	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 29196                                  
 29197                                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 29198                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29199                                  
 29200                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29201                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 29202                                  	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 29203                                  plE1:	
 29204                                  	;mov	ax,1
 29205                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 29206                                  	dec	si
 29207                                  	stc
 29208                                  	retn
 29209                                  
 29210                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 29211                                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 29212                                  	; 12/12/2022
 29213                                  	; cf=1
 29214                                  	;stc
 29215                                  	retn
 29216                                  plSwX:	
 29217                                  	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 29218                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 29219                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 29220                                  	; cf=0
 29221                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 29222                                  	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 29223                                  
 29224                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29225                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 29226                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29227                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29228                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29229                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29230                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 29231                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29232                                  
 29233                                  ;incArgc:
 29234                                  	;push	ax
 29235                                  
 29236                                  	;;getdata al, fm_argc	; Obtain previous value of fm_argc,
 29237                                  
 29238                                  	;mov	al,[cs:fm_argc]
 29239                                  
 29240                                  	;inc	al		; Increment it,
 29241                                  
 29242                                  	;;putdata fm_argc, al	; And store it right back.
 29243                                  
 29244                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_argc],al
 29245                                  
 29246                                  	;pop	ax
 29247                                  	;retn
 29248                                  
 29249                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29250                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29251                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29252                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29253                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 29254                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29255                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29256                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29257                                  
 29258                                  isEOL:
 29259                                  	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 29260                                  	je	short ieX
 29261                                  	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 29262                                  	je	short ieX
 29263                                  	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 29264                                  ieX:	
 29265                                  	retn
 29266                                  
 29267                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29268                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 29269                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29270                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 29271                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 29272                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29273                                  ; USES:     ZF
 29274                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29275                                  
 29276                                  isWhite:
 29277                                  	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 29278                                  	je	short iwX
 29279                                  	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 29280                                  	je	short iwX
 29281                                  	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 29282                                  iwX:	
 29283                                  	retn
 29284                                  
 29285                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29286                                  ;*** unMarkUMB - marks a given UMB as unused, even if previously marked used
 29287                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29288                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number
 29289                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29290                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29291                                  ; USES:     Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29292                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29293                                  
 29294                                  unMarkUMB:
 29295                                  	push	ax
 29296                                  	push	bx
 29297                                  	push	di
 29298                                  	push	es
 29299                                  
 29300                                  	push	cs
 29301                                  	pop	es
 29302                                  
 29303                                  	xor	ah,ah
 29304                                  	mov	bx,ax
 29305                                  
 29306                                  	; 19/04/2019
 29307                                  	
 29308                                  	;mov	byte [es:bx+UmbUsed],0
 29309                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbUsed],ah ; 0
 29310                                  
 29311                                  	cmp	[es:UmbLoad],al
 29312                                  	jne	short umu10
 29313                                  
 29314                                  	;mov	[es:UmbLoad],0	; If unmarked the load UMB, load into convent.
 29315                                  	mov	[es:UmbLoad],ah ; 0
 29316                                  umu10:	
 29317                                  	pop	es
 29318                                  	pop	di
 29319                                  	pop	bx
 29320                                  	pop	ax
 29321                                  	retn
 29322                                  
 29323                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29324                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 29325                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 29326                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 29327                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 29328                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29329                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 29330                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29331                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 29332                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29333                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29334                                  
 29335                                  stowUMB:
 29336                                  	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 29337                                  	jb	short su10
 29338                                  	stc
 29339                                  	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 29340                                  su10:	
 29341                                  	push	bx
 29342                                  	push	di
 29343                                  	push	si
 29344                                  	push	ds
 29345                                  	push	es
 29346                                  	push	cs
 29347                                  	pop	es
 29348                                  	push	cs
 29349                                  	pop	ds
 29350                                  	
 29351                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 29352                                  	cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 29353                                  	jne	short su20
 29354                                  	mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 29355                                  su20:	
 29356                                  	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 29357                                  	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 29358                                  
 29359                                  	mov	bl,al
 29360                                  	xor	bh,bh
 29361                                  	mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 29362                                  
 29363                                  	xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 29364                                  
 29365                                  	or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 29366                                  	jz	short su30	; means an error.
 29367                                  
 29368                                  	stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 29369                                  su30:	
 29370                                  	pop	es
 29371                                  	pop	ds
 29372                                  	pop	si
 29373                                  	pop	di
 29374                                  	pop	bx
 29375                                  	retn
 29376                                  
 29377                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29378                                  ;*** stowSiz - marks a given UMB as having a given minimum size
 29379                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29380                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains UMB number, AX contains size
 29381                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29382                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29383                                  ; USES:     AX, DX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29384                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29385                                  
 29386                                  ; 13/05/2019
 29387                                  
 29388                                  stowSiz:
 29389                                  	push	bx
 29390                                  	;push	di ; ?
 29391                                  	push	es
 29392                                  
 29393                                  	push	cs
 29394                                  	pop	es	
 29395                                  
 29396                                  	mov	bl,cl			; Now bl==UMB number, AX==size
 29397                                  	mov	bh,0			;     bx==UMB number, AX==size
 29398                                  	shl	bl,1			;     bx==offset into array, AX=size
 29399                                  	mov	[es:bx+UmbSize],ax	; Store the size
 29400                                  	
 29401                                  	pop	es
 29402                                  	;pop	di ; ?
 29403                                  	pop	bx
 29404                                  
 29405                                  	retn
 29406                                  
 29407                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29408                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 29409                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 29410                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 29411                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 29412                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29413                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 29414                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 29415                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 29416                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 29417                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29418                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 29419                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 29420                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 29421                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29422                                  
 29423                                  gnradix:
 29424                                  	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 29425                                  
 29426                                  toDigit:
 29427                                  	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 29428                                  	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 29429                                  
 29430                                  toDigit_hex:
 29431                                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 29432                                  	jb	short td10
 29433                                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 29434                                  	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 29435                                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 29436                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29437                                  	retn
 29438                                  td10:	
 29439                                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 29440                                  	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 29441                                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 29442                                  	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 29443                                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 29444                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29445                                  	retn
 29446                                  toDigit_dec:
 29447                                  td20:	
 29448                                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 29449                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 29450                                  	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 29451                                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 29452                                  	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 29453                                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 29454                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 29455                                  	retn
 29456                                  tdE:	
 29457                                  	stc
 29458                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 29459                                  	retn
 29460                                  
 29461                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29462                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 29463                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29464                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 29465                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 29466                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 29467                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 29468                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29469                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 29470                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 29471                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 29472                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29473                                  
 29474                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29475                                  
 29476                                  GetXNum:
 29477                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 29478                                  	push	bx
 29479                                  	push	cx
 29480                                  	push	ds
 29481                                  
 29482                                  	cld
 29483                                  	xor	ax,ax
 29484                                  	xor	bx,bx
 29485                                  	xor	cx,cx
 29486                                  	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 29487                                  
 29488                                  	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 29489                                  
 29490                                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 29491                                  	;call	toDigit
 29492                                  	call	toDigit_dec
 29493                                  	jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 29494                                  
 29495                                  	or	cl,cl
 29496                                  	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 29497                                  	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 29498                                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 29499                                  	je	short gxn10
 29500                                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 29501                                  	jne	short gxn20
 29502                                  
 29503                                  gxn10:	
 29504                                  	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 29505                                  	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 29506                                  	inc	si
 29507                                  
 29508                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 29509                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 29510                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
